exercises.name: Pull-Up
exercises.short_description: Bodyweight vertical pull from a dead hang to chin over the bar.
exercises.instructions: Grip the pull-up bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. Hang with straight arms and legs still. Brace your core, depress the shoulder blades, and pull your chest toward the bar until your chin clears it. Lower under control back to a dead hang and repeat.
cues: Start each rep from a dead hang
Keep ribs down and avoid swinging

exercises.name: Chin-Up
exercises.short_description: Supinated-grip vertical pull emphasizing biceps and lats.
exercises.instructions: Take an underhand grip on the bar about shoulder-width. Hang with straight arms. Set your shoulders down, brace, and pull until your chin clears the bar. Lower slowly to full extension and repeat.
cues: Avoid craning the neck to reach the bar

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Cable vertical pull to the upper chest.
exercises.instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown station with thighs secured. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width. Start with arms straight and shoulders set down. Pull the bar to the upper chest by driving elbows down. Pause briefly, then return to full stretch under control.
cues: Stop short of shrugging at the top

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row
exercises.short_description: Horizontal row using a cable station to target mid-back and lats.
exercises.instructions: Sit with feet on the platform and grasp the handle. Start tall with arms extended and shoulders down. Row the handle toward your lower ribs/upper abdomen by driving elbows back. Squeeze your back, then return the handle forward under control without rounding.
cues: Pull elbows back and close to the body
Control the stretch at the front

exercises.name: Bent-Over Barbell Row
exercises.short_description: Barbell row from a hip-hinged position to build back thickness and lats.
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width and grip the bar just outside shoulder-width. Hinge at the hips until your torso is inclined and back is flat. Start with arms straight. Row the bar toward your lower ribs/upper abdomen, then lower under control to full extension.
cues: Keep spine neutral and brace hard

exercises.name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
exercises.short_description: Single-arm row emphasizing lat engagement and scapular control.
exercises.instructions: Place one knee and one hand on a bench for support. Hold a dumbbell in the free hand with arm extended. Set the shoulder blade down and back, then row the dumbbell toward your hip/ribs. Pause, then lower to a full stretch.
cues: Pull toward the hip, not the shoulder
Keep shoulders square to the floor

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
exercises.short_description: Incline bench row to reduce lower-back load while training upper back and lats.
exercises.instructions: Set a bench to a moderate incline and lie chest-down holding dumbbells with arms hanging. Retract and depress the shoulder blades, then row the dumbbells toward your ribs. Lower slowly to a full hang and repeat.
cues: Keep chest glued to the bench

exercises.name: Inverted Row
exercises.short_description: Bodyweight horizontal pull under a bar or rings.
exercises.instructions: Set rings or a bar at waist to chest height. Lie underneath and grasp the handles/bar. Keep body in a straight line from head to heels. Pull your chest to the bar by driving elbows back. Lower under control to straight arms and repeat.
cues: Keep body rigid like a plank
Adjust difficulty by changing body angle

exercises.name: T-Bar Row (Chest Supported)
exercises.short_description: Supported row emphasizing mid-back and lats with minimal lower-back strain.
exercises.instructions: Set up in the chest-supported T-bar row machine. Grasp the handles and start with arms extended. Pull the handles toward your lower ribs while keeping chest on the pad. Pause, then lower to a full stretch.
cues: Keep chest pinned to the pad

exercises.name: Machine High Row
exercises.short_description: Machine row with a higher elbow path to target upper lats and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Adjust seat and chest pad so handles align comfortably. Start with arms extended and shoulders down. Pull the handles back toward your torso, keeping elbows slightly flared based on the machine path. Squeeze, then return with control.
cues: Keep shoulders down away from ears

exercises.name: Straight-Arm Cable Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Lat isolation using a straight-arm arc from overhead to hips.
exercises.instructions: Stand facing a high cable with a straight bar/rope. Take a slight hinge and brace. With elbows mostly straight, pull the handle down in an arc toward your thighs/hips. Pause with lats contracted, then return to a full overhead stretch under control.
cues: Keep elbows softly locked—don’t turn it into a row

exercises.name: Face Pull
exercises.short_description: Cable/band pull to the face to train rear delts and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Set a cable at upper-chest to face height with a rope handle. Grip with thumbs back and step away to tension. Pull the rope toward your face, separating hands and rotating so elbows move out and back. Pause, then return slowly.
cues: Finish with shoulder blades back and down

exercises.name: Reverse Pec Deck Fly
exercises.short_description: Machine rear-delt fly to strengthen posterior shoulders and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Sit facing the pec deck pad with handles set so arms are slightly bent. Keep chest on the pad. Sweep arms out and back until you feel rear delts and upper back contract. Return slowly to the start.

exercises.name: Barbell Curl
exercises.short_description: Classic elbow-flexion movement to build biceps strength and size.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding a barbell with an underhand grip shoulder-width. Keep elbows near your sides. Curl the bar up toward your shoulders without leaning back. Lower under control until arms are straight and repeat.
cues: Squeeze at the top, control down

exercises.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
exercises.short_description: Neutral-grip curl emphasizing brachialis and forearms with strong biceps carryover.
exercises.instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides with thumbs up. Keeping elbows close, curl both dumbbells up without rotating the wrists. Pause, then lower slowly to full extension.

exercises.name: EZ-Bar Preacher Curl
exercises.short_description: Supported curl to reduce body English and emphasize biceps through a strict path.
exercises.instructions: Set up at a preacher bench with an EZ-bar. Rest upper arms on the pad and start with elbows extended but not hyperextended. Curl the bar up toward your face/shoulders. Squeeze, then lower under control to near full extension.
cues: Keep upper arms glued to the pad
Stop short of locking out hard at the bottom

exercises.name: Cable Biceps Curl
exercises.short_description: Cable curl providing consistent tension through the full range of motion.
exercises.instructions: Attach a straight bar or rope to a low cable. Stand tall and grasp the handle with an underhand grip (or neutral with rope). Curl by flexing the elbows while keeping them close to your sides. Lower slowly to full extension and repeat.
cues: Keep tension—no resting at the bottom

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
exercises.short_description: Bench-supported curl that increases biceps stretch and reduces cheating.
exercises.instructions: Set an incline bench to about 45–60 degrees and sit back with dumbbells at your sides. Let arms hang slightly behind the torso. Curl the dumbbells up while keeping elbows relatively fixed. Lower slowly to a full stretch and repeat.

exercises.name: Band-Assisted Pull-Up
exercises.short_description: Pull-up variation using a resistance band for assistance through the range.
exercises.instructions: Loop a band over the pull-up bar and place one foot or knee in the band. Take your pull-up grip and hang tall. Pull up to chin over the bar, then lower under control to a dead hang, keeping band tension consistent.
cues: Use the smallest band that allows clean reps

exercises.name: Assisted Pull-Up (Machine)
exercises.short_description: Machine-assisted pull-up using a counterweight to reduce load.
exercises.instructions: Select assistance weight. Kneel or stand on the machine platform and grip the handles/bar. Start from arms extended. Pull up until chin clears the handles/bar, then lower under control to full extension and repeat.

exercises.name: Front Plank
exercises.short_description: Isometric hold on forearms to resist lumbar extension and maintain a rigid trunk.
exercises.instructions: Place forearms on the floor with elbows under shoulders and legs extended. Tuck pelvis slightly and brace the abdomen. Lift knees so your body forms a straight line from head to heels. Hold without letting the low back sag or hips pike.

exercises.name: Side Plank
exercises.short_description: Isometric hold on one forearm to resist side-bending and stabilize the trunk and pelvis.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your side with elbow under shoulder and legs straight. Stack feet and lift hips until your body is in a straight line. Keep hips tall and ribs down while you hold.

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.short_description: Supine core stability drill using contralateral limb movement while maintaining a neutral spine.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with hips and knees at 90 degrees and arms up. Brace and flatten the ribs toward the floor. Slowly extend one leg and the opposite arm toward the floor without losing low-back position. Return and alternate sides.
cues: Low back stays heavy on the floor

exercises.name: Bird Dog
exercises.short_description: Quadruped stability exercise emphasizing trunk control and anti-rotation with opposite arm/leg reach.
exercises.instructions: Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips. Brace your core. Reach one arm forward and the opposite leg back while keeping hips and ribs square. Return and repeat on the other side.
cues: Imagine balancing a glass on your back
Keep hips square to the floor

exercises.name: Hollow Body Hold
exercises.short_description: Gymnastics-based isometric hold emphasizing posterior pelvic tilt and anterior core endurance.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back, then tuck pelvis to flatten your low back to the floor. Lift shoulders and legs so you form a shallow “banana” shape while maintaining low-back contact. Hold with arms overhead or by your sides.
cues: Low back glued to the floor

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollout
exercises.short_description: Anti-extension core strength movement using an ab wheel to roll out and back under control.
exercises.instructions: Kneel with the ab wheel under shoulders and hands on handles. Brace and tuck pelvis slightly. Roll the wheel forward, keeping hips from sagging and ribs down. Stop before you lose control, then pull back to the start.
cues: Don’t let the low back arch

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.short_description: Anti-rotation press resisting sideways pull from a cable or band to train trunk stability.
exercises.instructions: Stand sideways to a cable/band anchor at chest height. Hold handle at your sternum with both hands and set your stance. Brace, then press arms straight out in front without rotating. Pause, return to chest, and repeat; switch sides.
cues: Don’t let the weight twist you
Move slow; pause at full extension

exercises.name: Cable Wood Chop
exercises.short_description: Rotational core isolation using a cable to chop diagonally across the body.
exercises.instructions: Set cable high or low depending on direction. Stand side-on to the stack and hold the handle with both hands. Brace and rotate through the torso to pull the handle diagonally across your body under control. Return slowly and repeat; switch sides.
cues: Rotate through the trunk, not just arms

exercises.name: Cable Crunch
exercises.short_description: Weighted spinal flexion emphasizing rectus abdominis via a kneeling cable setup.
exercises.instructions: Kneel facing away from the cable stack holding a rope at the sides of your head. Brace, then curl ribs toward pelvis to crunch down. Pause, then return to a tall kneeling position without pulling with the arms.

exercises.name: Hanging Knee Raise
exercises.short_description: Hanging core exercise bringing knees toward chest while minimizing swing and pelvic tilt loss.
exercises.instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with shoulders packed. Brace and slightly tuck pelvis. Raise knees toward your chest under control without swinging. Lower slowly to full hang and repeat.

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raise
exercises.short_description: Advanced hanging core movement lifting straight legs to train anterior core strength and control.
exercises.instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with shoulders engaged. Brace and keep legs straight as you lift them toward parallel or higher without swinging. Lower slowly to a controlled dead hang and repeat.
cues: Posteriorly tilt pelvis at the top

exercises.name: Lying Leg Raise
exercises.short_description: Supine straight-leg raise emphasizing lower abdominal control and anti-extension.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with legs straight and hands by your sides or under glutes. Brace and keep low back from arching. Lift legs to about 60–90 degrees, then lower slowly until just above the floor while maintaining position. Repeat.

exercises.name: Reverse Crunch
exercises.short_description: Core isolation movement curling the pelvis off the floor to emphasize lower rectus abdominis.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and hips flexed to 90 degrees. Brace, then curl your pelvis up, bringing knees toward your chest without using momentum. Lower slowly until hips touch down and repeat.
cues: Initiate with the pelvis, not a leg swing

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunch
exercises.short_description: Alternating cross-body crunch combining trunk rotation with hip flexion for oblique emphasis.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with hands lightly behind head and knees up. Lift shoulders and extend one leg while rotating torso to bring opposite elbow toward the bent knee. Alternate sides in a controlled pedaling motion.

exercises.name: Russian Twist
exercises.short_description: Seated trunk rotation drill targeting obliques; can be done bodyweight or with load.
exercises.instructions: Sit with knees bent and lean back slightly with a braced torso. Lift feet slightly if appropriate. Rotate your torso side to side, touching hands to the floor near each hip under control.
cues: Keep chest proud and ribs down

exercises.name: Back Extension
exercises.short_description: Posterior chain and trunk extension movement emphasizing spinal erectors and hip extension control.
exercises.instructions: Set up on a back extension bench with hips supported and feet secured. Brace and keep a neutral spine. Hinge down under control, then extend back up to a straight line without hyperextending. Repeat.

exercises.name: Superman Hold
exercises.short_description: Prone isometric back extension hold targeting spinal erectors and posterior chain endurance.
exercises.instructions: Lie face down with arms extended overhead. Brace glutes and lift arms, chest, and legs slightly off the floor. Hold briefly, then lower under control and repeat or hold for time.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge March
exercises.short_description: Single-leg alternating march from a glute bridge position to train pelvic stability and core control.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Lift hips into a bridge and brace. Without letting hips drop or rotate, lift one knee toward your chest, set it down, then alternate sides.

exercises.name: Suitcase Carry
exercises.short_description: Unilateral loaded carry emphasizing anti-lateral flexion and trunk stiffness while walking.
exercises.instructions: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell at your side like a suitcase. Stand tall and brace. Walk forward for distance or time without leaning toward the weight. Switch hands and repeat.

exercises.name: Farmer's Carry
exercises.short_description: Bilateral loaded carry building trunk stiffness, grip strength, and whole-body stability.
exercises.instructions: Pick up weights at your sides with a tall posture. Brace your core and walk forward under control. Turn carefully and continue for distance or time, then set down safely.

exercises.name: Sprint (Flat, Max Effort)
exercises.short_description: Short-distance maximal sprint on flat ground for speed development.
exercises.instructions: Warm up thoroughly. From a standing or rolling start, accelerate hard to top speed and maintain for the planned distance. Decelerate gradually and fully recover before the next rep.
cues: Drive knees and punch the ground back
Finish through the line then ease down

exercises.name: Acceleration Sprint (10–30 m)
exercises.short_description: Short sprint focused on first-step quickness and acceleration mechanics.
exercises.instructions: Start from a 2-point, 3-point, or standing start. Explode forward, gradually rising to upright as you accelerate through 10–30 m. Walk back recovery.
cues: Gradually rise to tall sprint posture

exercises.name: Flying Sprint (Build + Fly)
exercises.short_description: Top-speed sprint where you build up then sprint a timed fly zone.
exercises.instructions: Jog or stride into a build zone (e.g., 20–40 m), then sprint maximally through a fly zone (e.g., 10–30 m). Decelerate smoothly and rest fully.
cues: Stay tall in the fly zone

exercises.name: Hill Sprint
exercises.short_description: Short sprint up a hill to build acceleration power and mechanics.
exercises.instructions: Choose a moderate incline. Sprint hard uphill for 6–12 seconds. Walk down for full recovery before repeating.

exercises.name: Tempo Run (Track)
exercises.short_description: Sustained comfortably hard run to improve aerobic power and running efficiency.
exercises.instructions: After warming up, run at a steady pace you can maintain continuously (often 15–40 minutes depending on level). Cool down afterward.

exercises.name: Interval Run (400 m Repeats)
exercises.short_description: Repeated 400 m efforts with planned rest to build speed endurance and VO2max.
exercises.instructions: Warm up. Run 400 m at target pace, then recover (jog/walk) for a set time or distance. Repeat for the prescribed number of reps. Cool down.
cues: Hit the same pace each rep

exercises.name: Fartlek Run
exercises.short_description: Unstructured speed play alternating faster and easier running segments.
exercises.instructions: During a continuous run, alternate surges (e.g., 30–120 seconds) with easy running recoveries. Continue for the planned duration, then cool down.

exercises.name: Long Run
exercises.short_description: Easy to moderate continuous run to build aerobic endurance and durability.
exercises.instructions: Run continuously for an extended duration at a conversational pace. Fuel and hydrate as needed for longer sessions. Cool down and stretch lightly.
cues: Keep it easy enough to talk

exercises.name: Easy Run (Recovery Run)
exercises.short_description: Low-intensity run to promote recovery and maintain aerobic volume.
exercises.instructions: Run at a very comfortable pace for 20–60 minutes depending on training level. Keep effort light and steady.
cues: Finish feeling better than you started

exercises.name: Strides (100 m)
exercises.short_description: Short controlled accelerations to reinforce mechanics and leg speed without fatigue.
exercises.instructions: After an easy run or warm-up, accelerate smoothly to fast-but-relaxed pace over ~100 m, then walk/jog back for full recovery. Repeat as programmed.

exercises.name: A-Skip
exercises.short_description: Running drill emphasizing knee drive, posture, and rhythm.
exercises.instructions: Skip forward with an upright torso, driving one knee up to about hip height while the opposite arm swings naturally. Land under the body and cycle to the next skip.

exercises.name: B-Skip
exercises.short_description: Running drill emphasizing knee drive, extension, and active ground strike.
exercises.instructions: Drive the knee up, then extend the lower leg forward and sweep it down/back to the ground under the hips before cycling to the next step.

exercises.name: High Knees (Running Drill)
exercises.short_description: Quick cadence drill to train knee lift, posture, and foot speed.
exercises.instructions: Run in place or forward over 10–30 m bringing knees up toward hip height while maintaining quick ground contacts and active arms.

exercises.name: Butt Kicks (Running Drill)
exercises.short_description: Drill emphasizing heel recovery and quick turnover.
exercises.instructions: Jog forward or in place, rapidly flexing the knee to bring heels toward the glutes while keeping knees pointed down and cadence quick.

exercises.name: Carioca (Grapevine)
exercises.short_description: Lateral movement drill improving hip mobility, coordination, and rotational control.
exercises.instructions: Move laterally while crossing the trailing leg in front, then behind, alternating in a rhythmic pattern. Keep hips and torso controlled.

exercises.name: Bounding (Running Bounds)
exercises.short_description: Exaggerated running leaps to develop power, stiffness, and stride mechanics.
exercises.instructions: Leap forward from one leg to the other with long, powerful strides. Maintain posture and rhythmic arm action. Use full recovery between sets.

exercises.name: Ankling (Ankle Dribbles)
exercises.short_description: Short-stride drill emphasizing foot strike under the body and elastic lower-leg action.
exercises.instructions: Move forward with very small steps, quick contacts, and minimal knee lift. Focus on elastic ankle action and posture.

exercises.name: Sprint Start (3-Point Start)
exercises.short_description: Explosive sprint start from a 3-point stance to develop first-step power.
exercises.instructions: Set one hand on the ground, hips slightly above shoulders, weight distributed for a strong push. On the start, drive out low and accelerate for 10–20 m.

exercises.name: Relay Handoff Drill (4x100)
exercises.short_description: Baton exchange practice to improve timing, acceleration, and clean handoffs.
exercises.instructions: Practice outgoing runner acceleration in the exchange zone. Incoming runner approaches at speed and passes the baton using the chosen technique (e.g., upsweep). Reset and repeat.
cues: Outgoing runner accelerates, doesn’t look back

exercises.name: Curve Running (Track Bend Repeats)
exercises.short_description: Running repeats on the curve to improve mechanics and speed maintenance on bends.
exercises.instructions: Run controlled repeats focusing on posture and foot placement while staying in your lane on the curve. Use easy recovery between reps.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Classic horizontal press for chest, triceps, and shoulders using a barbell.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a flat bench with eyes under the bar. Set feet flat and brace. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width, unrack, and lower to mid-chest with elbows at a comfortable angle. Press the bar up to lockout while keeping your upper back tight and wrists stacked over elbows.
cues: Set shoulder blades down and back
Keep feet planted and drive through the floor
Lower with control to the same touch point each rep
Press up and slightly back toward the rack

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Horizontal press using dumbbells to train chest and pressing stability.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding dumbbells at chest level with palms facing forward or slightly angled. Set feet, brace, and press the dumbbells up until elbows are straight. Lower under control until the dumbbells are near chest level and repeat.
cues: Touch a consistent depth without bouncing
Squeeze the dumbbells and control the descent

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Incline pressing variation emphasizing upper chest and anterior delts.
exercises.instructions: Set an incline bench (about 20–45 degrees). Lie back with feet planted and upper back tight. Unrack the bar, lower to upper chest/clavicle area with control, then press to lockout without letting shoulders roll forward.
cues: Press up and back over shoulders

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Incline dumbbell pressing for upper chest and shoulder-friendly range of motion.
exercises.instructions: Set an incline bench. Start with dumbbells at upper chest/shoulder line. Brace, press up to full extension, then lower slowly until you reach a comfortable stretch and repeat.
cues: Stop at a depth you can own

exercises.name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Decline pressing variation emphasizing lower chest and triceps.
exercises.instructions: Set a decline bench and secure your legs. Unrack the bar with tight upper back. Lower to lower chest under control and press to lockout while keeping wrists stacked and shoulder blades tight.
cues: Maintain a stable torso and tight upper back
Lower to a consistent touch point
Drive the bar to straight arms

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press
exercises.short_description: Seated vertical press focusing on delts and triceps with dumbbells.
exercises.instructions: Sit tall on a bench with back support or upright. Start dumbbells at shoulder height. Brace your core and press overhead until elbows are straight. Lower with control back to shoulder level and repeat.

exercises.name: Standing Barbell Overhead Press
exercises.short_description: Strict standing overhead press building shoulder strength and full-body tension.
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet about hip width, bar at upper chest/front rack. Brace, squeeze glutes, and press the bar overhead while moving your head slightly back then through. Lock out over midfoot and lower to the start under control.
cues: Squeeze glutes and keep ribs down

exercises.name: Push-Up
exercises.short_description: Foundational bodyweight horizontal press for chest, triceps, and core stability.
exercises.instructions: Start in a plank with hands under or slightly wider than shoulders. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels. Lower until your chest is close to the floor, then press back to the top without letting hips sag.
cues: Screw hands into the floor for shoulder stability
Keep elbows at a comfortable angle

exercises.name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Bench press variation with narrower grip to emphasize triceps.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a flat bench and grip the bar just inside shoulder width. Unrack and lower to mid-chest with elbows tucked more than a standard bench. Press back to lockout, keeping wrists stacked and upper back tight.
cues: Keep elbows close to your sides
Touch the same point each rep

exercises.name: Dips (Chest Lean)
exercises.short_description: Dip variation with forward torso lean to emphasize chest while training triceps and shoulders.
exercises.instructions: Support yourself on parallel bars or rings with arms locked. Lean slightly forward and keep legs behind you. Lower until shoulders are below elbows or to comfortable depth, then press back to lockout.
cues: Keep shoulders down away from ears
Lean forward slightly for chest bias

exercises.name: Machine Chest Press
exercises.short_description: Guided horizontal press on a machine for chest and triceps strength.
exercises.instructions: Adjust seat so handles align with mid-chest. Grip handles, retract shoulder blades, and press to near lockout. Return under control until elbows reach a comfortable depth and repeat.
cues: Set seat height for a natural press path

exercises.name: Smith Machine Bench Press
exercises.short_description: Bench press performed in a Smith machine for a fixed bar path and stability.
exercises.instructions: Set a flat bench under the Smith bar. Position hands evenly, unrack, and lower to mid-chest with control. Press up to lockout and re-rack safely.
cues: Set bench position so bar touches mid-chest
Keep wrists stacked and elbows under bar

exercises.name: Cable Chest Fly
exercises.short_description: Cable fly to train chest through horizontal adduction with constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Set cables slightly below or at shoulder height. Step forward into a staggered stance, elbows softly bent. Bring hands together in front of your chest, then return slowly until you feel a chest stretch without losing shoulder control.
cues: Keep a soft bend in elbows throughout
Move from the shoulders, not the hands
Keep ribs down and torso steady

exercises.name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
exercises.short_description: Dumbbell fly to isolate the chest with a large stretch emphasis.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a flat bench with dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other. With elbows slightly bent, lower the dumbbells out and down in an arc until you feel a stretch. Bring them back together over the chest without changing elbow angle much.
cues: Don’t turn it into a press
Lower slowly and stop before shoulder discomfort

exercises.name: Arnold Press
exercises.short_description: Dumbbell shoulder press with rotation to challenge delts through a longer range.
exercises.instructions: Start seated with dumbbells in front of shoulders, palms facing you. Press overhead while rotating palms to face forward at the top. Reverse the motion on the way down to return to the start position.
cues: Keep ribs down and core braced

exercises.name: Dumbbell Floor Press
exercises.short_description: Horizontal dumbbell press from the floor to limit shoulder extension and emphasize lockout.
exercises.instructions: Lie on the floor with knees bent, dumbbells at chest level. Press dumbbells up to lockout. Lower until upper arms lightly contact the floor, pause briefly, then press again.
cues: Pause gently on the floor each rep
Keep wrists stacked and elbows under dumbbells
Keep shoulder blades stable against the floor

exercises.name: Barbell Floor Press
exercises.short_description: Barbell press from the floor emphasizing triceps and mid-range strength.
exercises.instructions: Lie on the floor inside a rack or with spotters. Unrack the bar to above your chest. Lower until triceps touch the floor, pause briefly, and press to lockout.
cues: Pause on the floor without bouncing

exercises.name: Landmine Press (Single-Arm)
exercises.short_description: Angled single-arm press that trains shoulders and chest with strong core anti-rotation demand.
exercises.instructions: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment or secure corner. Hold the free end at shoulder height with one hand. Brace and press the bar up and forward until arm is extended, then lower with control.
cues: Keep ribs down and glutes tight

exercises.name: Cable Triceps Pushdown
exercises.short_description: Cable isolation exercise to train triceps elbow extension.
exercises.instructions: Attach a bar or rope to a high cable. Stand tall with elbows pinned near your sides. Extend elbows to push the handle down until arms are straight, then return under control without letting elbows drift forward.

exercises.name: Skull Crushers (EZ-Bar Lying Triceps Extension)
exercises.short_description: Lying triceps extension emphasizing long head of triceps and elbow control.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench holding an EZ-bar over your chest with elbows pointing up. Bend elbows to lower the bar toward forehead or slightly behind the head. Extend elbows to return to the start without letting upper arms drift excessively.
cues: Lower under control to a consistent target

exercises.name: Back Squat
exercises.short_description: Barbell squat with the bar supported on the upper back.
exercises.instructions: Set the bar on your upper back (high-bar or low-bar position). Stand with feet about shoulder-width, brace your core, and unlock the hips and knees together to sit down between your heels. Descend to a depth you can control while keeping your torso rigid and knees tracking over toes. Drive up by pushing the floor away until you stand tall.
cues: Keep mid-foot pressure and full-foot contact.
Drive up with chest and hips rising together.

exercises.name: Front Squat
exercises.short_description: Barbell squat with the bar racked on the front of the shoulders.
exercises.instructions: Rack the bar on the front delts with elbows high (front rack). Stand with feet shoulder-width, brace, and squat down under control while keeping the torso upright. Hit a stable depth and stand by driving through the mid-foot to full extension.
cues: Elbows high; bar close to throat.
Keep heels down and knees forward.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.short_description: Squat holding a dumbbell vertically at the chest.
exercises.instructions: Hold a dumbbell by the ends at chest height. Stand with feet about shoulder-width, brace, and squat down keeping the weight close. Descend to a comfortable depth, then drive up to standing.
cues: Keep the weight tight to your chest.
Sit between your hips; don’t collapse inward.

exercises.name: Box Squat
exercises.short_description: Barbell squat to a box/bench to standardize depth and reinforce sitting back.
exercises.instructions: Set a box at the target depth behind you. Unrack the bar on your back, step back, and squat down until you lightly touch the box. Keep tension, then drive up to standing without rocking.
cues: Control the descent to the box.
Stay braced and tight on the box.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.short_description: Rear-foot-elevated split squat emphasizing single-leg strength and stability.
exercises.instructions: Stand a stride length in front of a bench and place your rear foot on it. Keep torso tall, brace, and lower your back knee toward the floor by bending the front knee and hip. Descend under control, then push through the front foot to stand.
cues: Front foot planted; knee tracks over toes.
Drive through mid-foot/heel of the lead leg.

exercises.name: Walking Lunge
exercises.short_description: Alternating forward lunges performed continuously while walking.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall, step forward into a long stride, and lower until both knees bend comfortably with the front shin near vertical. Push through the front foot to bring the back leg through into the next step. Continue alternating sides.
cues: Keep hips level as you step.

exercises.name: Reverse Lunge
exercises.short_description: Step-back lunge emphasizing hip control and knee-friendly loading for many lifters.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall, step one foot back, and lower until the front leg and back leg are comfortably bent. Keep most of the load over the front leg. Push through the front foot to return to standing and repeat.

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Hip hinge deadlift variation emphasizing hamstrings and glutes with minimal knee bend.
exercises.instructions: Hold a barbell at hip height with a shoulder-width grip. Set a soft knee bend, brace, and push hips back while keeping the bar close to your legs. Lower until you feel a strong hamstring stretch without losing a flat back, then drive hips forward to stand tall.
cues: Keep the bar close to your body.
Finish by squeezing glutes, not leaning back.

exercises.name: Conventional Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Barbell pull from the floor using a hip hinge and leg drive.
exercises.instructions: Set feet about hip-width with the bar over mid-foot. Grip the bar, bring shins to the bar, set your back tight, and brace. Push the floor away and stand up with the bar traveling close to your body. Lower under control to the floor.
cues: Bar over mid-foot; keep it close.
Brace and pull slack out of the bar.
Stand tall by locking hips and knees together.

exercises.name: Sumo Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Wide-stance deadlift emphasizing hips and adductors with a more upright torso.
exercises.instructions: Take a wide stance with toes turned out. Grip the bar inside your legs, brace, and set the torso tall. Push the floor away and extend hips and knees to stand. Lower the bar with control, keeping knees tracking out.
cues: Keep chest tall and hips close.

exercises.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Deadlift performed inside a hex/trap bar with neutral grips.
exercises.instructions: Stand centered in the trap bar with feet hip-width. Grip the handles, brace, and lower hips until you can drive through the floor. Stand up keeping torso rigid and shoulders packed, then lower under control.
cues: Control the descent to the floor.

exercises.name: Good Morning
exercises.short_description: Barbell hip hinge with the bar on the back to train posterior chain strength and control.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on your upper back like a squat. Take a hip-width stance, soften knees, brace, and hinge by pushing hips back. Lower torso until you reach your range while maintaining a neutral spine, then return by driving hips forward.

exercises.name: Hip Thrust
exercises.short_description: Glute-focused hip extension with upper back supported on a bench.
exercises.instructions: Sit with your upper back against a bench and a barbell across your hips. Plant feet about shoulder-width and brace. Drive through your heels to lift hips until your torso and thighs are roughly in line, then lower under control.
cues: Drive hips up; squeeze glutes at the top.
Shins near vertical at the top.

exercises.name: Glute Bridge
exercises.short_description: Supine hip extension emphasizing glutes with shoulders on the floor.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Brace your core and press through your heels to lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees. Pause and squeeze, then lower with control.

exercises.name: Step-Up
exercises.short_description: Single-leg step onto an elevated surface to train leg strength and balance.
exercises.instructions: Stand facing a bench/box. Place one foot fully on the surface, brace, and drive through that leg to stand on top. Control the descent back to the floor and repeat, keeping most load on the working leg.
cues: Drive through the lead leg; minimal push from trailing foot.
Keep hips level and knee tracking over toes.

exercises.name: Barbell Walking Lunge
exercises.short_description: Walking lunge performed with a barbell on the back for increased loading.
exercises.instructions: Place a barbell on your upper back and brace. Step forward into a lunge, lower under control, then push through the front foot to bring the back leg through into the next step. Continue alternating while maintaining posture.
cues: Stay tall; keep the bar stable.

exercises.name: Smith Machine Squat
exercises.short_description: Squat performed with a bar fixed on a guided track.
exercises.instructions: Set the Smith bar to shoulder height and position it across your upper back. Place feet to achieve your preferred squat pattern, brace, then squat down under control. Drive up to standing and re-rack safely.
cues: Keep feet flat and knees tracking.
Use a consistent stance each set.

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.short_description: Machine-based lower-body press mimicking a squat pattern with back support.
exercises.instructions: Sit in the leg press with back and hips supported. Place feet on the platform, unrack, and lower the sled by bending hips and knees under control. Press the platform away to near full extension without locking aggressively.
cues: Keep hips down and back supported.
Avoid bouncing out of the bottom.

exercises.name: Hack Squat (Machine)
exercises.short_description: Machine squat pattern with back support and a guided path.
exercises.instructions: Set shoulders under pads and feet on the platform. Unrack, then lower under control by bending knees and hips. Drive up through the feet to extend legs and return to the top position.
cues: Keep heels down and knees tracking.

exercises.name: Leg Extension
exercises.short_description: Knee extension machine targeting the quadriceps.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat so the knee aligns with the machine pivot and the pad rests above the ankles. Brace your torso, extend knees to lift the pad, pause briefly, then lower under control to the start.
cues: Keep hips down on the seat.
Squeeze quads at the top without kicking.

exercises.name: Rowing Ergometer Intervals
exercises.short_description: High-intensity intervals performed on a rowing machine to improve aerobic and anaerobic capacity.
exercises.instructions: Set the damper and foot straps. Warm up 5–10 minutes easy. Perform repeated work bouts (e.g., 30–60 seconds hard) separated by easy rowing recovery. Maintain strong leg drive, then hip swing, then arm pull; reverse on the return. Cool down 5 minutes easy.
cues: Drive with legs first, then hips, then arms
Stay tall; don’t collapse at the catch
Recover smoothly; keep the chain level
Match stroke rate to target intensity

exercises.name: Air Bike Sprint Intervals
exercises.short_description: All-out sprint intervals on an air bike to build power-endurance and conditioning.
exercises.instructions: Adjust seat height so knee is slightly bent at the bottom. Warm up 5 minutes building pace. Perform sprints (e.g., 10–20 seconds all-out) with full or partial recovery (e.g., 40–100 seconds easy). Cool down 5 minutes easy.
cues: Push and pull the handles aggressively
Stay seated for consistency; stand only if planned
Keep sprints truly hard; recover enough to repeat quality

exercises.name: Treadmill Sprint Intervals
exercises.short_description: HIIT running performed on a treadmill using short fast efforts with recovery.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes easy jog. Choose a sprint speed you can repeat safely. Perform intervals (e.g., 15–60 seconds fast) with walking/jogging recovery. Use the safety clip and step off the belt if needed. Cool down 5 minutes.
cues: Shorten stride slightly as speed increases
Land under your center of mass
Keep shoulders relaxed and arms driving
Prioritize repeatable speed over reckless top speed

exercises.name: Incline Treadmill Hill Intervals
exercises.short_description: Intervals performed at higher incline to emphasize posterior chain and cardiovascular demand.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at low incline. Set a challenging incline (e.g., 6–15%) and fast walk or run for the work interval, then lower incline for recovery. Repeat for multiple rounds and cool down.
cues: Drive knees forward and push the belt back
Maintain tall posture; avoid leaning on rails
Keep cadence steady as incline rises
Use incline changes to control intensity

exercises.name: Stationary Bike HIIT Intervals
exercises.short_description: High-intensity intervals on a stationary bike to improve metabolic conditioning with low impact.
exercises.instructions: Set saddle height so knee is slightly bent at bottom of pedal stroke. Warm up 5 minutes. Alternate hard efforts (e.g., 20–60 seconds) with easy pedaling recovery. Adjust resistance to hit target effort. Cool down 5 minutes.
cues: Keep hips stable; don’t rock side to side
Use resistance to avoid spinning out
Finish intervals with controlled breathing in recovery

exercises.name: Ski Erg Intervals
exercises.short_description: Intervals on a ski erg emphasizing upper-body pulling and trunk/hip drive for high output.
exercises.instructions: Set damper and strap in or stand stable. Warm up easy pulls. For work intervals, drive handles down with a strong crunch/hip hinge, then recover smoothly overhead. Repeat rounds with easy recovery pulls.
cues: Initiate with lats and trunk, not just arms
Keep ribs down and spine neutral
Stay smooth on the return to keep rhythm

exercises.name: Stair Climber Intervals
exercises.short_description: Interval training on a stair climber to build leg endurance and cardiovascular fitness.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at an easy step rate. Increase speed for the work interval, then reduce speed for recovery. Maintain upright posture and avoid leaning on rails. Repeat for prescribed rounds.
cues: Light touch on rails; don’t support bodyweight
Stand tall and drive through glutes
Keep a steady rhythm during work bouts

exercises.name: Elliptical HIIT Intervals
exercises.short_description: Low-impact HIIT intervals on an elliptical to elevate heart rate with reduced joint stress.
exercises.instructions: Warm up easy for 5 minutes. Increase resistance and/or cadence for the work interval, then back off for recovery. Use handles if available for full-body effort. Cool down easy.
cues: Push and pull evenly with arms (if using handles)
Use resistance to control intensity rather than flailing faster

exercises.name: Arc Trainer Intervals
exercises.short_description: Intervals on an arc trainer-style elliptical to target lower-body endurance with low impact.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at low resistance. Perform work bouts by increasing resistance and/or cadence, then recover at easier settings. Maintain a smooth stride and stable torso. Cool down.
cues: Keep feet planted; avoid heel lift when possible
Push through midfoot for strong output
Smooth transitions between work and recovery

exercises.name: Rowing Machine Tabata
exercises.short_description: Tabata protocol on a rower: 20 seconds hard, 10 seconds rest for 8 rounds.
exercises.instructions: Warm up thoroughly. Set monitor for Tabata if available. Row 20 seconds near-max effort, rest 10 seconds, repeat for 8 rounds. Cool down and record total meters.
cues: Keep technique clean as fatigue rises
Breathe fast but don’t clamp down
Aim for consistent meters per interval

exercises.name: Air Bike Tabata
exercises.short_description: Tabata protocol performed on an air bike to drive heart rate rapidly.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–8 minutes. Perform 8 rounds of 20 seconds very hard and 10 seconds complete rest or very easy pedaling. Cool down until breathing normalizes.
cues: Pace the first 2 rounds so you can finish all 8

exercises.name: Treadmill HIIT (1:1 Intervals)
exercises.short_description: Treadmill intervals using equal work and recovery durations for repeatable HIIT.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Run fast for a set time (e.g., 1 minute), then jog or walk for the same time (1 minute). Repeat for multiple rounds and cool down.
cues: Pick a pace you can repeat across rounds
Keep recovery truly easy to preserve quality
Use incline slightly (0.5–1%) to mimic outdoor running if desired

exercises.name: Bike Hill Climb Intervals (Resistance)
exercises.short_description: Stationary bike intervals emphasizing higher resistance to simulate hill climbing.
exercises.instructions: Warm up easy. Increase resistance and maintain a strong, controlled cadence for the work interval, then reduce resistance for recovery. Repeat for prescribed rounds and cool down.
cues: Keep cadence steady; don’t grind to a stop
Drive down and back through the pedal
Use resistance changes to hit target effort

exercises.name: Rowing Machine Pyramid Intervals
exercises.short_description: Rowing intervals that increase then decrease in duration to train pacing and capacity.
exercises.instructions: Warm up easy. Perform a pyramid (e.g., 1-2-3-4-3-2-1 minutes hard) with equal or slightly longer easy recovery between efforts. Cool down easy.
cues: Start controlled; don’t sprint the early steps
Keep stroke rate appropriate to the interval length

exercises.name: Treadmill Incline Walk Intervals
exercises.short_description: Brisk incline walking intervals to raise heart rate with minimal running impact.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at flat easy walk. Alternate higher incline brisk walking work bouts with lower incline recovery walking. Maintain a steady pace and cool down at flat incline.
cues: Don’t hold the rails; keep arms swinging
Push through the big toe to engage calves/glutes
Stay tall; avoid excessive forward lean

exercises.name: Rowing Machine Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous rowing at a sustainable pace to build aerobic base with full-body involvement.
exercises.instructions: Set a sustainable pace you can hold for 15–60 minutes. Row continuously, focusing on smooth technique and controlled breathing. Finish with an easy cool down.

exercises.name: Stationary Bike Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous cycling at a steady pace to improve aerobic capacity with low impact.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the bike for comfort. Pedal continuously for 20–60 minutes at a pace where you can speak short sentences. Keep cadence and resistance steady.

exercises.name: Treadmill Steady-State Jog
exercises.short_description: Continuous treadmill jogging at an easy to moderate intensity for aerobic development.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with a walk. Jog at a comfortable pace for 15–60 minutes. Optionally set 0.5–1% incline. Cool down by walking.

exercises.name: Elliptical Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous elliptical training at a steady pace for low-impact aerobic work.
exercises.instructions: Select a moderate resistance and cadence you can maintain. Move continuously for 20–60 minutes, keeping posture tall and movement smooth.
cues: Keep feet flat and pressure even
Use resistance to keep heart rate in target zone

exercises.name: Stair Climber Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous stair climbing at a controlled pace to build aerobic fitness and leg endurance.
exercises.instructions: Choose a step rate you can hold for 10–40 minutes. Stay upright and step continuously without stopping. Cool down with a slower rate.
cues: Full steps with controlled foot placement

exercises.name: Steady-State Run
exercises.short_description: Continuous running at a conversational, sustainable pace to build aerobic endurance.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy jogging for 5–10 minutes. Run at a steady pace you can maintain for the planned duration. Keep effort controlled and breathing rhythmic. Cool down with 5–10 minutes easy jogging or walking.
cues: Tall posture with slight forward lean
Land under your center of mass

exercises.name: Tempo Run
exercises.short_description: Sustained run at comfortably hard effort to improve lactate threshold.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 10–15 minutes easy. Run continuously at a comfortably hard pace (you can speak only short phrases) for the planned duration. Cool down 10 minutes easy.
cues: Even pacing from start to finish
Stay relaxed through shoulders and jaw

exercises.name: Interval Run
exercises.short_description: Repeated fast running bouts with recovery to build speed and aerobic power.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 10–15 minutes. Perform repeated fast efforts (e.g., 200–1000 m) with easy jog or walk recovery between reps. Maintain consistent pace across reps. Cool down 10 minutes easy.
cues: Hit the same split each rep
Recover fully enough to repeat quality

exercises.name: Hill Repeats (Running)
exercises.short_description: Repeated uphill efforts with recovery to build strength, power, and aerobic capacity.
exercises.instructions: Choose a moderate hill. Warm up easy. Run hard uphill for a set time or distance, then walk/jog back down for recovery. Repeat for planned reps. Cool down easy.
cues: Drive knees and push the ground back
Keep chest tall and eyes forward
Use the downhill for recovery, not speed

exercises.name: Indoor Cycling (Steady Ride)
exercises.short_description: Continuous cycling at moderate effort to build aerobic base with low impact.
exercises.instructions: Set bike fit (seat height and fore-aft). Warm up at easy resistance. Ride continuously at a steady effort, adjusting cadence and resistance to stay in the target zone. Cool down easy.

exercises.name: Cycling Intervals
exercises.short_description: Repeated hard efforts on a bike with recovery to improve power and VO2.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 8–15 minutes. Perform hard intervals (by time or distance) with easy spinning recoveries between efforts. Keep cadence consistent and effort repeatable. Cool down 5–10 minutes easy.
cues: Ramp into each interval, don’t sprint instantly
Recover easy so the next rep is quality

exercises.name: Outdoor Road Cycling
exercises.short_description: Continuous cycling outdoors to build endurance, aerobic capacity, and pacing skills.
exercises.instructions: Check bike and safety gear. Start with easy pedaling to warm up. Ride at the planned effort, managing cadence and gears for terrain. Finish with an easy spin to cool down.
cues: Spin easier gears on climbs to save legs
Fuel and hydrate for longer rides

exercises.name: Assault Bike (Steady Ride)
exercises.short_description: Low-impact full-body air bike ride at a controlled aerobic pace.
exercises.instructions: Set seat height. Start pedaling and moving arms smoothly. Find a pace you can maintain without spiking heart rate. Keep the effort even for the full duration.
cues: Drive legs and match with arms

exercises.name: Rowing Machine (Steady Row)
exercises.short_description: Continuous rowing at moderate effort to build aerobic endurance and technique.
exercises.instructions: Set damper and foot straps. Warm up with easy strokes. Row continuously at a steady pace, focusing on consistent stroke rate and power. Cool down with easy rowing.
cues: Legs drive first, then hips, then arms
Keep handle path level to the sternum

exercises.name: Rowing Intervals
exercises.short_description: Repeated hard rowing bouts with recovery to improve power and aerobic capacity.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 8–12 minutes. Perform timed or distance-based hard intervals with easy rowing between efforts. Keep stroke rate and split targets consistent. Cool down easy.
cues: Stay long and powerful—don’t shorten the stroke
Breathe in recovery, exhale on drive

exercises.name: Swim Freestyle (Steady)
exercises.short_description: Continuous freestyle swimming at a sustainable pace to build aerobic capacity and technique.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy freestyle. Swim continuously at a steady pace, breathing rhythmically (every 2–3 strokes or as needed). Focus on efficient body position. Cool down easy.
cues: Long body line—hips near the surface
Exhale underwater, inhale quickly to the side
High elbow catch and strong pull
Kick from the hips, not the knees

exercises.name: Swim Intervals
exercises.short_description: Repeated swim reps with rest to develop speed, fitness, and pacing in the water.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy swimming. Perform a set of repeats (e.g., 25–200 m) at the target pace with planned rest. Keep technique consistent across reps. Cool down easy.
cues: Even splits beat fast first reps

exercises.name: Swim Breaststroke (Steady)
exercises.short_description: Continuous breaststroke at an easy-to-moderate pace to build aerobic endurance and coordination.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy strokes. Swim breaststroke continuously, timing the pull, breath, kick, and glide. Maintain a steady effort and controlled breathing. Cool down easy.
cues: Keep hips high and streamline on the glide
Kick from the hips with feet turned out
Don’t over-lift the head to breathe

exercises.name: Treadmill Run (Steady)
exercises.short_description: Continuous running on a treadmill to build aerobic fitness with controlled pacing.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at easy pace. Set a steady speed (and optional incline) you can maintain. Run continuously, adjusting speed slightly to stay in the target effort. Cool down by reducing speed to a walk.
cues: Use slight incline if desired for realism

exercises.name: Treadmill Incline Walk
exercises.short_description: Brisk uphill walking on a treadmill for low-impact aerobic conditioning and posterior-chain emphasis.
exercises.instructions: Set incline and a brisk walking speed. Walk continuously while maintaining an upright torso. Adjust incline or speed to keep effort in the target zone. Cool down by reducing incline and speed.
cues: Keep hips under you—avoid excessive forward lean
Shorten stride slightly as incline increases

exercises.name: Cycling Cadence Drills
exercises.short_description: Structured cadence changes to improve pedaling efficiency and leg speed.
exercises.instructions: Warm up easy. Alternate blocks of higher cadence at lighter resistance with moderate cadence at slightly higher resistance. Keep the session controlled and smooth. Cool down easy.
cues: Keep hips still as cadence rises

exercises.name: Rowing Technique Drill (Pause Row)
exercises.short_description: Rowing drill with brief pauses to reinforce correct sequencing and positions.
exercises.instructions: Row at easy effort. Insert brief pauses at key positions (finish, body-over, half-slide) during the recovery. Resume rowing smoothly after each pause while keeping stroke rhythm consistent.
cues: Legs then body then arms on the drive
Arms then body then legs on the recovery
Stay smooth—no jerking into the next phase

exercises.name: Open Water Swim
exercises.short_description: Swimming outdoors to build endurance and comfort with navigation, conditions, and pacing.
exercises.instructions: Swim in a safe, supervised environment. Warm up near shore. Swim at the planned effort, periodically sighting to stay on course. Return with a relaxed cool down near shore.
cues: Sight forward briefly without dropping hips
Swim smooth in chop—don’t fight the water

exercises.name: Brick Workout (Bike to Run)
exercises.short_description: Back-to-back cycling then running to train the transition and endurance under fatigue.
exercises.instructions: Complete a planned bike segment at steady or moderate effort. Transition quickly (change shoes if needed). Start the run easy, then settle into target pace. Cool down after the run.
cues: Finish the bike with a slightly higher cadence
Start the run conservatively for the first minutes
Hydrate and fuel based on total duration

exercises.name: Handstand (Wall Assisted)
exercises.short_description: Inverted hold with heels supported by a wall to build handstand alignment and balance.
exercises.instructions: Place hands on the floor shoulder-width apart 6–12 inches from a wall. Kick up to a straight-body handstand with heels lightly touching the wall. Stack wrists, shoulders, hips, and ankles. Hold while maintaining a hollow body position and steady breathing.
cues: Push the floor away; shrug to the ears
Use the wall as a guide, not a crutch

exercises.name: Freestanding Handstand Hold
exercises.short_description: Unassisted handstand balance hold emphasizing alignment, control, and fingertip corrections.
exercises.instructions: Kick or press up to a handstand on the floor with straight arms. Stack shoulders over wrists and keep a hollow body shape. Use finger pressure and subtle shoulder/hip adjustments to balance. Hold for time and come down under control.
cues: Balance with fingers, not the hips

exercises.name: L-Sit (Parallettes)
exercises.short_description: Hollow-body support hold with straight legs lifted to hip height using parallettes or similar supports.
exercises.instructions: Place hands on parallettes and press tall through locked elbows. Lift both legs together until thighs are parallel to the floor and knees remain straight. Keep shoulders depressed and ribs down. Hold for time.

exercises.name: Tuck Planche Hold
exercises.short_description: Planche progression holding a tucked position with shoulders protracted and body leaned forward.
exercises.instructions: Place hands on the floor or parallettes and lean shoulders forward past the wrists. Protract and depress the shoulders. Bring knees to the chest (tuck) and lift feet off the ground while maintaining straight arms. Hold briefly with control.
cues: Hollow body; knees tight to chest

exercises.name: Frog Stand
exercises.short_description: Intro balance hold with knees supported on the upper arms and feet lifted off the floor.
exercises.instructions: Squat and place hands shoulder-width on the floor. Bend elbows slightly and place knees high on the backs of the arms. Shift weight forward until feet lift. Hold while keeping gaze slightly forward and steady breathing.

exercises.name: Front Lever Tuck Hold
exercises.short_description: Front lever progression holding a tucked body position with the torso parallel to the ground.
exercises.instructions: Hang from a bar or rings with a shoulder-width grip. Pull shoulder blades down and back, then bring knees toward the chest. Lean back and lift hips until your back approaches parallel to the floor. Hold with arms straight and active shoulders.
cues: Push bar down; keep shoulders packed
Keep tuck tight; posterior pelvic tilt
Aim for a flat back position

exercises.name: Back Lever Tuck Hold
exercises.short_description: Back lever progression holding a tucked position with the body facing down and shoulders extended.
exercises.instructions: From a hang on rings or a bar, move into an inverted hang (if skilled) and rotate to a back lever path. Keep arms straight and shoulders active. Tuck knees to chest and extend hips until your torso is near parallel to the floor. Hold with control.
cues: Keep tuck tight and hips extended

exercises.name: Muscle-Up (Bar)
exercises.short_description: Explosive pull-up transitioning over the bar into a dip to reach support.
exercises.instructions: Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulders. Perform a powerful pull-up driving elbows down and back, then transition the chest over the bar. Immediately press down into a straight-arm support, then lower under control.
cues: Pull high to the lower chest
Keep wrists over the bar during transition
Finish with locked elbows at the top

exercises.name: Skin the Cat (Rings)
exercises.short_description: Ring skill rotating from hang through inverted position into a controlled German hang and back.
exercises.instructions: Hang from rings with a tight body. Tuck knees and rotate backward to an inverted hang. Continue rotating by extending hips until reaching a German hang (shoulders extended). Pause if comfortable, then reverse the motion back to hang.
cues: Keep rings close to the body
Stay tucked until you can control extension
Respect shoulder range; don’t force depth

exercises.name: German Hang (Rings)
exercises.short_description: Shoulder extension mobility/strength position held on rings with the body hanging through the arms behind.
exercises.instructions: Enter the German hang from a controlled skin-the-cat. Keep arms straight and shoulder blades active. Hold at a comfortable depth while maintaining steady breathing, then return carefully.
cues: Only go as deep as you can control

exercises.name: Ring Support Hold (Top Support)
exercises.short_description: Stable straight-arm hold on rings with turned-out hands to build support strength and control.
exercises.instructions: Jump or press into a top support on rings with arms locked. Turn rings out slightly and keep shoulders depressed. Maintain a tall posture with ribs down and legs together. Hold for time.

exercises.name: Ring Dip (Strict)
exercises.short_description: Strict dip on rings emphasizing stability, depth control, and straight wrists.
exercises.instructions: Start in a ring support with locked arms. Lower under control by bending elbows and allowing rings to move slightly while keeping shoulders stable. Reach a comfortable depth, then press back to locked elbows without swinging.
cues: Keep rings close to the body

exercises.name: Ring Row (Inverted Row on Rings)
exercises.short_description: Bodyweight horizontal row using rings; scalable by adjusting body angle.
exercises.instructions: Set rings to about waist height. Hold rings with straight arms and walk feet forward to create a lean. Keep body rigid and pull chest toward the rings, then lower with control to straight arms.
cues: Keep body in a straight line
Pull elbows back; squeeze shoulder blades
Control the bottom and top positions

exercises.name: Tuck Front Lever Row
exercises.short_description: Rowing movement performed while holding a tuck front lever position to build lever pulling strength.
exercises.instructions: Set up on low rings or a bar so you can start in a tuck front lever (hips up, knees tucked). Keeping hips lifted and arms straight at the bottom, row by bending elbows and pulling the chest toward the hands. Lower back to straight arms without losing body position.
cues: Row with elbows; keep shoulders packed

exercises.name: Pistol Squat (Assisted)
exercises.short_description: Single-leg squat to full depth using assistance (support or band) to build strength, balance, and mobility.
exercises.instructions: Hold a stable support (pole, rings, or band) for balance. Extend one leg forward and squat down on the working leg, keeping the heel down. Reach a comfortable depth, then stand back up using minimal assistance.
cues: Use just enough help to control depth

exercises.name: Pistol Squat (Unassisted)
exercises.short_description: Full-range single-leg squat requiring balance, ankle mobility, and unilateral strength.
exercises.instructions: Stand on one leg and extend the other leg forward. Brace the core and squat down under control, keeping the working heel grounded. Reach full depth if able, then stand back up without using momentum.
cues: Keep heel down; knee tracks forward
Keep chest up; arms can counterbalance

exercises.name: V-Sit Hold
exercises.short_description: Advanced core hold lifting straight legs above hip height while supporting bodyweight through the hands.
exercises.instructions: From an L-sit support on parallettes or floor, compress hips and lift straight legs higher toward the torso. Keep elbows locked and shoulders depressed. Hold the V position without rounding excessively through the shoulders.

exercises.name: Arch Body Hold (Superman Hold)
exercises.short_description: Gymnastics arch position holding an extended spine with chest and thighs lifted off the floor.
exercises.instructions: Lie face down with arms overhead. Squeeze glutes and lift chest, arms, and thighs off the floor. Keep neck neutral and legs long. Hold for time and lower under control.

exercises.name: Cartwheel
exercises.short_description: Basic gymnastics tumbling skill moving laterally through a hand-supported inversion.
exercises.instructions: Start standing with one foot forward and arms overhead. Reach to the side and place the first hand on the ground, then the second hand in line. Kick legs overhead passing through an inverted split. Land one foot then the other facing the opposite direction.
cues: Hands down in a straight line
Look at the hands as they place

exercises.name: Cross-Country Skiing (Classic)
exercises.short_description: Endurance skiing on groomed tracks using classic stride technique.
exercises.instructions: Use a diagonal stride: drive one leg back while the opposite arm plants the pole. Maintain a tall posture, shift weight fully onto the gliding ski, and keep the kick under your center of mass. Repeat rhythmically over varied terrain.
cues: Stay tall with ribs stacked over hips
Commit weight to the gliding ski
Kick down and back, not forward
Relax shoulders; pole from the strap

exercises.name: Cross-Country Skiing (Skate)
exercises.short_description: Endurance skiing using a skating stride for higher speed and lateral push-off.
exercises.instructions: Angle skis in a V and push laterally and backward from the edge. Transfer balance fully to the gliding ski, then repeat to the other side. Coordinate poling with each step depending on terrain and cadence.
cues: Push to the side and back off the edge
Balance over one ski before switching
Keep hips tall; avoid sitting back
Quiet upper body; power from legs

exercises.name: Downhill Skiing (Alpine)
exercises.short_description: Alpine skiing on groomed or variable slopes emphasizing turning, edge control, and leg endurance.
exercises.instructions: Adopt an athletic stance with shins contacting the boot tongues. Initiate turns by tipping skis onto their edges and guiding with the legs while keeping the torso stable. Absorb terrain through ankles, knees, and hips.
cues: Turn with the legs, not the shoulders
Pressure the outside ski through the turn

exercises.name: Mogul Skiing
exercises.short_description: Skiing over moguls requiring rapid absorption, balance, and repeated eccentric leg loading.
exercises.instructions: Maintain a narrow stance and absorb bumps by flexing ankles, knees, and hips. Keep the torso facing downhill and use quick, short turns to control speed while staying centered over the skis.

exercises.name: Ski Touring (Uphill Skinning)
exercises.short_description: Uphill travel on skis with skins, building steady-state leg endurance and balance on climbs.
exercises.instructions: Use a short stride to keep skins gripping. Keep weight over the midfoot, maintain a smooth cadence, and avoid lifting the ski unnecessarily. Use kick turns on steep switchbacks.
cues: Keep hips over feet for traction

exercises.name: Snowshoeing
exercises.short_description: Walking or hiking on snow with snowshoes; strong leg endurance demand and balance on uneven terrain.
exercises.instructions: Walk with a slightly wider stance to avoid stepping on the opposite shoe. Keep steps short on climbs, drive through the whole foot, and use poles as needed for balance.
cues: Wide enough stance to clear the frames

exercises.name: Ice Skating (Recreational)
exercises.short_description: Recreational skating focusing on balance, glide efficiency, and lateral push-off.
exercises.instructions: Bend knees slightly and keep hips over skates. Push to the side with one foot and glide on the other, switching rhythmically. Use arms for balance and look ahead.
cues: Push to the side, then glide
Look where you want to go

exercises.name: Speed Skating
exercises.short_description: High-speed skating with deep knee bend and powerful lateral push for leg endurance.
exercises.instructions: Maintain a low athletic position with a flat back. Push laterally through the edge and return the foot under the body for a long glide. Keep arms controlled for stability and rhythm.

exercises.name: Ski Jump Turns (On Snow)
exercises.short_description: Explosive ski turns using small hops to change direction; improves agility, balance, and leg endurance.
exercises.instructions: In a stable stance, compress into a shallow squat, then hop and rotate the skis to face the new direction. Land softly, absorb through the legs, and immediately prepare for the next hop turn.

exercises.name: Ski Side-Stepping (Uphill)
exercises.short_description: Uphill movement by stepping skis laterally; builds leg endurance and edge-control balance.
exercises.instructions: Set edges into the snow and step the uphill ski higher, then bring the downhill ski to meet it. Keep torso upright and weight on edges to prevent slipping.
cues: Stay tall—don’t fold at the waist

exercises.name: Skating Stride Drills (Off-Snow)
exercises.short_description: Dryland skating-stride practice emphasizing lateral push-off and single-leg balance.
exercises.instructions: On flat ground, push diagonally back and out with one leg and glide briefly on the other (simulating ski glide). Alternate sides with a smooth cadence, keeping hips level.
cues: Push out and back, then balance

exercises.name: Lateral Skater Jumps
exercises.short_description: Side-to-side bounds mimicking skating/skiing push-off; trains lateral power, balance, and endurance.
exercises.instructions: Start on one leg, hinge slightly at the hip, then bound laterally to land on the opposite leg. Absorb the landing with a soft knee and stable hip, then immediately bound back.
cues: Stick the landing briefly before rebounding
Keep chest proud and hips back

exercises.name: Slide Board Lateral Stride
exercises.short_description: Lateral sliding strides on a slide board to build skating/skiing-specific endurance and balance.
exercises.instructions: On the slide surface, push laterally to glide to the opposite side, staying low with stable torso. Tap the stop with controlled pressure and immediately push back.

exercises.name: Sled Lateral Drag
exercises.short_description: Sideways sled dragging to develop lateral strength-endurance for edging and skating patterns.
exercises.instructions: Attach straps/handles, face sideways, and take lateral steps while maintaining a low athletic stance. Keep hips and shoulders aligned and move steadily for distance or time, then switch sides.

exercises.name: Shuttle Runs (Lateral)
exercises.short_description: Side-shuffling shuttle runs to build lateral endurance, coordination, and change-of-direction control.
exercises.instructions: Set two markers 5–15 meters apart. Shuffle laterally between markers without crossing feet, touch the line/marker, and return. Repeat for reps or time.
cues: Feet stay parallel; don’t cross over
Push the ground away each step

exercises.name: Single-Leg Balance (On Ice or Packed Snow)
exercises.short_description: Static single-leg balance on a slippery surface to improve ankle/knee/hip control for winter sports.
exercises.instructions: Stand on one leg on a safe, flat icy/packed-snow surface near support. Slightly bend the knee, keep hips level, and hold. Switch legs. Progress by moving arms or turning the head.
cues: Tripod foot pressure; don’t grip with toes
Use support as needed for safety

exercises.name: Snow Plow Turns (Ski Drill)
exercises.short_description: Beginner ski drill using a wedge stance to control speed and practice turning with leg steering.
exercises.instructions: Form a wedge with skis (tips closer, tails wider). Apply pressure to the outside ski to initiate a turn while keeping the upper body facing downhill. Alternate turns in a controlled manner.
cues: Steer with the legs, torso quiet

exercises.name: Hockey Stops (Ice Skating Drill)
exercises.short_description: Quick lateral stop on ice developing edge control, deceleration strength, and balance.
exercises.instructions: Skate forward, then rotate hips and shoulders slightly and turn both skates sideways to the direction of travel. Press edges into the ice to stop while keeping knees bent and torso stable.
cues: Pressure edges; stay balanced over skates
Stop with hips/legs, not leaning back
Start slow and build speed safely

exercises.name: Ski Poling (Double Pole Drill)
exercises.short_description: Nordic double-poling drill emphasizing core-to-arm power transfer and endurance.
exercises.instructions: With skis gliding, plant both poles slightly ahead of the feet. Hinge slightly at the hips and drive poles down and back using the lats and triceps while bracing the core. Recover tall and repeat.
cues: Plant close; push down and back

exercises.name: Winter Hill Hike (Boots)
exercises.short_description: Hiking uphill on snow in boots to build winter-specific leg endurance and balance on uneven footing.
exercises.instructions: Choose a safe incline with good traction. Take short steps, keep torso tall, and drive through the full foot. Use poles if needed. Descend carefully with controlled steps.
cues: Stay tall and stack over midfoot
Dress and fuel for cold exposure

exercises.name: Basketball Defensive Slide Drill
exercises.short_description: Lateral defensive shuffles emphasizing stance, speed, and change of direction.
exercises.instructions: Start in an athletic stance with hips back, chest up, and feet slightly wider than shoulder-width. Shuffle laterally to one side without crossing your feet, keeping toes mostly forward and hips low. Plant the outside foot to change direction and shuffle back. Maintain a defensive stance and consistent tempo for the prescribed distance or time.
cues: Don’t click heels or cross feet
Push the floor away with the outside leg

exercises.name: Basketball Closeout Drill
exercises.short_description: Sprint into a controlled stop with hands up to simulate closing out on a shooter.
exercises.instructions: Start several meters from a target line or cone. Sprint forward, then decelerate into a wide base with one foot slightly forward, hips low, and hands high. Take quick choppy steps as you approach to avoid over-running. Recover by backpedaling or shuffling to the start and repeat.
cues: Sprint, then chop steps to brake

exercises.name: Basketball Zig-Zag Defensive Drill
exercises.short_description: Reactive change-of-direction shuffles along a zig-zag path on the court.
exercises.instructions: Set cones in a zig-zag pattern down the court. Start in a defensive stance and shuffle to the first cone. Plant, change direction, and shuffle to the next cone. Continue through the pattern without crossing your feet. Walk back to recover and repeat.
cues: Plant outside foot to change direction

exercises.name: Basketball Drop Step Drill
exercises.short_description: Quick hip turn and push-off used to cut off driving lanes or open up to sprint.
exercises.instructions: Start in an athletic stance. Step one foot back and slightly out (drop step) while turning the hips and shoulders in the direction you’re moving. Immediately push off the front foot to accelerate 2–5 steps. Reset and alternate sides.
cues: Push explosively off the lead foot

exercises.name: Basketball Backpedal to Sprint Transition Drill
exercises.short_description: Backpedal then rapidly transition to a forward sprint, simulating defensive recovery.
exercises.instructions: Mark a start line and a turn line. Backpedal quickly to the turn line with hips low and feet under you. Plant one foot, turn, and sprint forward past the start line for a few steps. Walk back and repeat.
cues: Stay on the balls of your feet while backpedaling
Lean and punch the first sprint step
Keep hips low, don’t pop up

exercises.name: Basketball Lateral Cone Shuffle Drill
exercises.short_description: Timed lateral shuffles between cones to build court lateral quickness.
exercises.instructions: Place two cones 3–6 meters apart. Start in a defensive stance at one cone. Shuffle laterally to the other cone, touch the line or cone base, then shuffle back. Repeat for time or reps.

exercises.name: Basketball Suicide (Line Drill)
exercises.short_description: Classic basketball conditioning sprint drill touching progressively farther court lines.
exercises.instructions: Start on the baseline. Sprint to the free-throw line and back, then to half-court and back, then to the far free-throw line and back, then to the far baseline and back. Touch each line with a hand. Rest and repeat as programmed.

exercises.name: Basketball 17s Drill
exercises.short_description: Sideline-to-sideline full-court sprints targeting a set number within a time cap.
exercises.instructions: Start on one sideline at the baseline. Sprint to the opposite sideline and touch the line, then sprint back. Continue until you complete 17 touches (or 17 lengths) within the prescribed time. Rest and repeat.

exercises.name: Basketball Lane Agility Drill
exercises.short_description: Agility pattern around the key combining sprint, shuffle, and backpedal.
exercises.instructions: Use the lane lines and baseline to form a rectangle. Sprint from baseline to free-throw line along one lane line, shuffle across the free-throw line, backpedal down the opposite lane line, then shuffle across the baseline to the start. Repeat for rounds, alternating direction.

exercises.name: Basketball Jump Stop Drill
exercises.short_description: Two-foot landing and deceleration drill for control, balance, and pivot readiness.
