exercises.instructions: Jog or sprint forward 5–10 meters. Plant and jump into a simultaneous two-foot landing with knees bent and hips back (jump stop). Hold balance briefly, then reset or add a pivot. Repeat for reps.

exercises.name: Basketball Tuck Jump Drill
exercises.short_description: Explosive vertical jump bringing knees toward chest to develop power and reactivity.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width. Dip quickly into a quarter squat and jump straight up. At the top, pull knees up toward the chest. Land softly with knees bent and immediately reset for the next rep or perform continuous reps with control.
cues: Stop if height or landing quality drops

exercises.name: Basketball Depth Jump (Box Drop Jump)
exercises.short_description: Step off a box, land, and immediately rebound into a maximal vertical jump.
exercises.instructions: Stand on a stable box/bench. Step off (do not jump) and land on both feet. Absorb the landing quickly and immediately explode upward into a vertical jump. Reset between reps for quality.
cues: Step off—don’t leap off the box
Stiff but safe landing: knees over toes
Use a box height you can control

exercises.name: Basketball Lateral Bound (Skater Jump)
exercises.short_description: Single-leg lateral jumps to develop lateral power and landing control.
exercises.instructions: Start on one leg with a slight knee bend. Jump laterally to the opposite side and land on the other leg, absorbing with hips back and knee aligned. Stabilize briefly, then bound back. Continue alternating sides.
cues: Stick the landing—knee tracks over toes
Use arms for balance and power

exercises.name: Basketball Broad Jump (Standing Long Jump)
exercises.short_description: Two-foot horizontal jump for lower-body power useful for first-step explosiveness.
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet hip-to-shoulder width. Swing arms back and hinge slightly, then explode forward and up, landing on both feet. Absorb the landing with knees and hips bent. Reset and repeat.
cues: Jump forward with full hip extension
Land softly with a wide base
Stick the landing before next rep

exercises.name: Basketball Split Squat Jump
exercises.short_description: Explosive lunge jump alternating legs to build unilateral power and coordination.
exercises.instructions: Start in a split stance with both knees slightly bent. Dip into a shallow lunge and jump vertically, switching legs in the air. Land softly into the opposite split stance and repeat for controlled reps.
cues: Keep reps crisp—stop before form breaks

exercises.name: Basketball Rim Touch Jumps
exercises.short_description: Max-effort vertical jumps attempting to touch the rim or backboard for jump training.
exercises.instructions: Stand under the basket with a comfortable approach (standing or 1–2 step). Dip quickly and jump as high as possible to touch the rim/backboard. Land softly, reset fully, and repeat for quality reps.
cues: Max effort each rep with full rest

exercises.name: Basketball Quick Feet Line Hops
exercises.short_description: Rapid small jumps over a court line to build ankle stiffness and foot speed.
exercises.instructions: Stand with both feet together straddling a court line. Hop quickly side-to-side over the line with minimal height. Keep hops rhythmic for time, then rest and repeat. Can also be done front-to-back.
cues: Stay on the balls of the feet

exercises.name: Basketball Agility Ladder Drill (In-In-Out-Out)
exercises.short_description: Footwork ladder pattern to build coordination and quick ground contacts.
exercises.instructions: Place an agility ladder on the court. Step both feet into a rung (in-in), then step both feet outside the ladder (out-out) as you move forward. Continue through the ladder at speed while staying light on your feet. Rest and repeat.

exercises.name: Basketball Lateral Agility Ladder Shuffle
exercises.short_description: Sideways ladder shuffle emphasizing lateral foot speed and hip control.
exercises.instructions: Stand sideways to the ladder. Step the lead foot into the first rung, bring the trail foot in, then step both feet out to the other side as you move laterally down the ladder. Continue for the full length, then switch directions.
cues: Stay low like a defensive stance
Feet move fast; hips stay stable

exercises.name: Basketball Cone Weave Sprint Drill
exercises.short_description: Sprint and weave through cones to train cutting mechanics and acceleration.
exercises.instructions: Set 5–8 cones in a straight line with 2–4 meters spacing. Sprint toward the first cone and cut around each cone in an S-pattern. Accelerate out of each cut and finish with a strong sprint past the last cone. Walk back to recover and repeat.
cues: Lower center of gravity before each cut
Plant outside foot and drive out

exercises.name: Basketball Rebound Jump Drill
exercises.short_description: Repeated explosive jumps simulating rebounding with strong reach and landing control.
exercises.instructions: Stand near the basket. Perform a maximal vertical jump with arms reaching high as if securing a rebound, then land in an athletic stance. Reset quickly and repeat for a set number of reps, focusing on jump quality and safe landings.
cues: Jump from hips and legs, not just calves
Keep reps powerful with short sets

exercises.name: World's Greatest Stretch
exercises.short_description: A full-body mobility drill combining a lunge, thoracic rotation, and hamstring stretch.
exercises.instructions: Start in a high plank. Step your right foot outside your right hand into a deep lunge. Drop your hips and keep your back leg long. Place your left hand on the floor and rotate your right arm up toward the ceiling, opening the chest. Return the hand down, shift hips back to straighten the front leg for a hamstring stretch, then return to plank and switch sides.
cues: Keep your back knee straight and heel driving back
Rotate through the upper back, not the low back
Keep the front knee tracking over the toes
Breathe slowly and deeply into the stretch

exercises.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
exercises.short_description: Spinal mobility drill alternating between flexion and extension on all fours.
exercises.instructions: Set up on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips. Inhale and arch the back, lifting the chest and tailbone (cow). Exhale and round the spine, tucking the pelvis and drawing the ribs up (cat). Move slowly through a comfortable range for reps.
cues: Move one vertebra at a time
Keep elbows straight but not locked
Avoid pinching in the low back

exercises.name: Child's Pose
exercises.short_description: A resting stretch that opens the back, lats, and shoulders while flexing the hips.
exercises.instructions: Kneel on the floor and sit your hips back toward your heels. Reach your arms forward on the floor and lower your chest toward the ground. Relax into the position and breathe steadily.
cues: Breathe into your ribs and back
Use a wider knee stance if needed for comfort

exercises.name: Thread the Needle Stretch
exercises.short_description: Thoracic rotation stretch from quadruped to open the upper back and rear shoulder.
exercises.instructions: Start on hands and knees. Slide your right arm under your left arm, rotating your torso until your right shoulder and ear rest on the floor. Keep hips stacked over knees. Hold briefly, then return and repeat; switch sides.
cues: Rotate from the ribs and upper back
Reach long through the threading arm
Avoid shrugging the shoulder toward the ear

exercises.name: Couch Stretch
exercises.short_description: A kneeling hip flexor and quad stretch using a wall or bench for support.
exercises.instructions: Place one knee on the floor close to a wall or bench and position the same-side foot up against it. Step the other foot forward into a kneeling lunge. Squeeze the glute of the rear leg and lift the torso upright to increase the stretch. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Squeeze the rear glute to protect the low back
Increase range slowly—this stretch is intense

exercises.name: 90/90 Hip Stretch
exercises.short_description: Hip internal/external rotation stretch using two 90-degree knee angles on the floor.
exercises.instructions: Sit on the floor with your front leg bent at about 90 degrees in front of you and your back leg bent about 90 degrees behind you. Keep your torso tall and lean forward over the front shin to feel the stretch. Return upright and switch sides as needed.
cues: Keep both sit bones heavy on the floor
Lead with the chest when leaning forward
Avoid collapsing through the low back
Use hands for support as needed

exercises.name: Pigeon Pose
exercises.short_description: A deep hip external rotation stretch targeting the glutes and posterior hip.
exercises.instructions: From a plank, bring one knee forward and place it behind the same-side wrist, with the shin angled across the body. Extend the other leg back. Square the hips as best you can and stay tall or fold forward to increase the stretch. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Keep hips as level as possible
Use a pad under the front hip if needed

exercises.name: Standing Calf Stretch (Wall)
exercises.short_description: A wall-supported calf stretch targeting the gastrocnemius and Achilles.
exercises.instructions: Face a wall and place both hands on it. Step one foot back and keep that heel down with the knee straight. Bend the front knee and lean toward the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Keep the back knee straight for gastrocnemius emphasis
Move slowly to avoid Achilles irritation

exercises.name: Kneeling Ankle Dorsiflexion Stretch
exercises.short_description: An ankle mobility drill to improve dorsiflexion in a kneeling position.
exercises.instructions: Kneel with one foot flat in front of you. Keeping the heel down, drive the knee forward over the toes until you feel a stretch at the ankle. Rock back and forth for reps or hold end range, then switch sides.
cues: Track the knee over the middle toes
Go to a mild stretch, not pain

exercises.name: Deep Squat Hold (Prying Squat)
exercises.short_description: A bottom-position squat hold to open hips, ankles, and adductors.
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet about shoulder-width (adjust as needed). Sink into a deep squat with heels down if possible. Use elbows to gently press knees outward and shift side to side to explore range. Hold while breathing steadily.
cues: Use a counterbalance if heels lift
Keep chest tall and spine long
Breathe and relax into the bottom

exercises.name: Doorway Pec Stretch
exercises.short_description: A standing chest stretch using a doorway to open pecs and front shoulder.
exercises.instructions: Stand in a doorway and place your forearm on the door frame with elbow at about shoulder height. Step through gently and rotate your torso away until you feel a stretch across the chest. Hold and repeat on the other side.
cues: Keep ribs down to avoid over-arching
Feel stretch across the pec, not the front of the shoulder joint
Adjust elbow height to target different fibers

exercises.name: Cross-Body Shoulder Stretch
exercises.short_description: A simple stretch for the rear shoulder and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall and bring one arm across your body at shoulder height. Use the opposite arm to gently pull the arm closer to your chest. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Keep shoulder down away from the ear
Pull just above the elbow, not at the wrist

exercises.name: Sleeper Stretch
exercises.short_description: A shoulder internal rotation stretch performed lying on your side.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your side with the bottom arm in front of you and elbow at shoulder height, bent 90 degrees. Keep the shoulder blade set and gently press the forearm toward the floor using the top hand until you feel a stretch in the back of the shoulder. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Keep shoulder packed; don’t let it roll forward
Stop if you feel sharp pain
Breathe and relax the upper back

exercises.name: Wall Slides
exercises.short_description: A shoulder and thoracic mobility drill to improve overhead range and scapular control.
exercises.instructions: Stand with back against a wall, feet slightly forward. Keep ribs down and low back gently against the wall. Place forearms and hands on the wall and slide arms upward as high as you can while maintaining contact. Return under control for reps.
cues: Move slowly and control the scapulae

exercises.name: Thoracic Extension on Foam Roller
exercises.short_description: Upper-back extension drill using a roller to improve thoracic mobility.
exercises.instructions: Sit on the floor with a foam roller placed across your upper back. Support your head with your hands, keep ribs down, and gently extend your upper back over the roller. Return to neutral and repeat at a few different mid-to-upper back levels.
cues: Extend through the upper back, not the low back
Move slowly and avoid aggressive pressure
Exhale as you extend to gain range

exercises.name: Seated Hamstring Stretch
exercises.short_description: A seated forward fold to lengthen the hamstrings and posterior chain.
exercises.instructions: Sit with one or both legs extended. Keep the spine long and hinge forward at the hips, reaching toward your shin/foot until you feel a stretch in the hamstrings. Hold while breathing, then switch sides if doing single-leg.
cues: Hinge at hips, don’t round aggressively
Keep shoulders relaxed away from ears

exercises.name: Standing Quad Stretch
exercises.short_description: A classic standing stretch for the quadriceps and front of the hip.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall and hold a wall or support if needed. Bend one knee and grab the same-side ankle or foot, pulling the heel toward the glute. Keep knees close and pelvis tucked slightly. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: Tuck pelvis slightly to increase hip flexor stretch
Balance by fixing your gaze on a point

exercises.name: Butterfly Stretch
exercises.short_description: A seated groin stretch with soles of feet together to open the hips.
exercises.instructions: Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together, letting knees fall out to the sides. Hold your feet or ankles and gently hinge forward to increase the stretch. Hold while breathing steadily.
cues: Keep spine long; hinge from hips
Keep feet pulled in only as far as comfortable

exercises.name: Frog Stretch
exercises.short_description: A deep adductor stretch from a wide-knee quadruped position.
exercises.instructions: Start on hands and knees. Widen your knees as comfortable and turn feet out so inner shins contact the floor. Keep hips in line with knees and slowly rock hips back and forth to find a stretch in the groin. Hold or perform gentle rocks.
cues: Keep spine neutral and ribs down
Stay in a tolerable stretch range
Use pads under knees if needed

exercises.name: Neck Side Bend Stretch
exercises.short_description: A gentle stretch for the side of the neck and upper trapezius.
exercises.instructions: Sit or stand tall. Let one arm hang by your side and gently tilt your head away from that side, bringing ear toward shoulder. Optionally use the opposite hand to add light pressure. Hold, then switch sides.
cues: No aggressive pulling on the head
Stop if you feel tingling or sharp pain

exercises.name: Pendlay Row
exercises.short_description: Explosive barbell row from the floor each rep to build upper-back and lat strength.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on the floor. Hinge to a near-parallel torso with a flat back and grip the bar just outside shoulder width. Brace your core, pull the bar explosively to your lower chest/upper abdomen, then return it to the floor under control, resetting each rep.
cues: Start each rep dead from the floor
Pull elbows back; bar to upper abdomen

exercises.name: Meadows Row
exercises.short_description: Landmine-style one-arm barbell row emphasizing lats and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine or corner. Stand perpendicular to the bar and hinge at the hips. Grip the sleeve end with one hand and row it toward your hip/ribcage, then lower under control.
cues: Pull toward your hip to bias lats

exercises.name: Barbell Shrug
exercises.short_description: Upper-trap focused shrug with a barbell.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding a barbell at arm’s length. Without bending the elbows, elevate your shoulders straight up, pause briefly, then lower fully under control.
cues: Arms stay long; don’t curl the bar

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shrug
exercises.short_description: Upper-trap shrug performed with dumbbells for a natural arm path.
exercises.instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides. Elevate shoulders straight up, hold briefly, then lower to a full stretch.
cues: Keep neck long; don’t jut chin

exercises.name: Rack Pull (Above Knee)
exercises.short_description: Partial deadlift from the rack emphasizing upper back, traps, and lockout strength.
exercises.instructions: Set the bar on safety pins just above knee height. Grip the bar, brace, and hinge into position. Drive through the floor to stand tall, then lower back to the pins with control.
cues: Stand tall; don’t lean back excessively

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Dumbbell RDL emphasizing posterior chain with strong upper-back and lat tension.
exercises.instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs. Hinge hips back, lower dumbbells along the legs, then stand by driving hips forward while keeping a neutral spine.
cues: Feel hamstrings stretch; don’t squat it

exercises.name: Cable Rope Hammer Curl
exercises.short_description: Neutral-grip cable curl emphasizing brachialis and forearms.
exercises.instructions: Attach a rope to a low cable. Stand tall and hold rope ends with thumbs up. Curl hands toward shoulders without swinging, then lower under control.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
exercises.short_description: Strict single-arm curl for biceps peak contraction and minimal cheating.
exercises.instructions: Sit on a bench and brace your elbow against the inside of your thigh. Curl the dumbbell to shoulder height, pause, then lower slowly to full extension.

exercises.name: EZ-Bar Reverse Curl
exercises.short_description: Pronated-grip curl to build brachioradialis and forearm strength while training elbow flexors.
exercises.instructions: Hold an EZ-bar with an overhand grip. Curl the bar up without swinging, then lower under control to full elbow extension.
cues: Wrists straight; don’t let them bend back
Elbows stay slightly in front of ribs or at sides

exercises.name: Dumbbell Reverse Curl
exercises.short_description: Overhand dumbbell curl to emphasize forearms and brachialis.
exercises.instructions: Stand holding dumbbells with palms facing down. Curl up while keeping wrists neutral, then lower slowly.

exercises.name: Zottman Curl
exercises.short_description: Curl up supinated, rotate to pronated to lower—hits biceps and forearms.
exercises.instructions: Curl dumbbells up with palms up. At the top, rotate palms down and lower slowly. Rotate back to palms up at the bottom and repeat.
cues: Rotate at the top under control
Slow eccentric on the way down

exercises.name: Spider Curl (EZ-Bar)
exercises.short_description: Prone incline curl that keeps tension on the biceps with minimal cheating.
exercises.instructions: Lie face down on an incline bench with your chest supported and arms hanging. Curl an EZ-bar up toward the shoulders, pause, then lower to full extension.
cues: Keep upper arms perpendicular to floor

exercises.name: Machine Biceps Curl
exercises.short_description: Selectorized biceps curl for stable, consistent resistance.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat and arm pad so elbows align with the pivot. Grip handles and curl through full range, then lower under control without letting the stack slam.

exercises.name: Cable Reverse-Grip Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Supinated-grip pulldown emphasizing lats and biceps.
exercises.instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown station and grasp the bar with an underhand shoulder-width grip. Pull the bar down to upper chest while keeping torso tall, then return under control.
cues: Keep ribs down; avoid excessive lean

exercises.name: Cable Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Neutral-handle pulldown for a shoulder-friendly lat and upper-back pull.
exercises.instructions: Attach neutral handles or a V-handle to the high cable. Sit and brace. Pull handles down toward upper chest, then slowly return to a stretch overhead.

exercises.name: Wide-Grip Cable Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Wide-grip pulldown emphasizing upper lats and teres area with reduced biceps contribution.
exercises.instructions: Grip the pulldown bar wider than shoulders. Sit tall and pull the bar to the upper chest, then return slowly overhead.

exercises.name: Cable One-Arm Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Single-arm pulldown to train lats unilaterally and improve scapular control.
exercises.instructions: Attach a single handle to a high cable. Sit or kneel and brace. Pull the handle down toward the same-side ribcage, pause, then return to full overhead stretch.
cues: Pull elbow down to your hip
Reach up at the top for stretch

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover
exercises.short_description: Shoulder-extension pullover targeting lats with additional chest involvement.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench holding one dumbbell with both hands above chest. With a slight elbow bend, lower the dumbbell back behind your head until you feel a lat stretch, then pull it back to start.
cues: Move at the shoulder, not the elbows
Feel lats pull the weight back

exercises.name: Plank Shoulder Tap
exercises.short_description: Anti-rotation core drill performed from a high plank while alternating shoulder taps.
exercises.instructions: Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet slightly wider than hip-width. Brace your core and keep hips level. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder without shifting your torso. Return the hand to the floor and repeat on the other side for controlled reps.
cues: Squeeze glutes and brace ribs down

exercises.name: Body Saw (Forearm Plank)
exercises.short_description: Forearm plank variation where the body rocks forward and back to increase anti-extension demand.
exercises.instructions: Set up in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels. Shift your body forward a few inches by moving through the shoulders, then shift back to the starting position. Continue with small controlled rocks.
cues: Keep hips level and low back neutral

exercises.name: Stir-the-Pot (Stability Ball)
exercises.short_description: Forearm plank on a stability ball while making small circles to challenge core stability.
exercises.instructions: Place forearms on a stability ball and extend legs into a plank. Brace your core and keep hips steady. Move your forearms in small circles, maintaining a rigid torso. Perform circles in both directions.

exercises.name: Stability Ball Rollout
exercises.short_description: Kneeling rollout using a stability ball to train anti-extension and trunk stiffness.
exercises.instructions: Kneel with forearms or hands on a stability ball. Brace your core and squeeze glutes. Roll the ball forward, extending your arms while keeping your spine neutral. Stop before you lose control, then pull the ball back to the start using your lats and abs.

exercises.name: V-Up
exercises.short_description: Dynamic trunk flexion and hip flexion movement bringing hands and feet together in a V position.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with arms overhead and legs straight. Brace your core and lift your legs and upper back at the same time. Reach your hands toward your feet at the top. Lower under control to the start and repeat.

exercises.name: Sit-Up
exercises.short_description: Classic abdominal exercise involving trunk flexion from supine to seated.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet on the floor. Cross arms over chest or place hands lightly behind head. Brace your core and curl up, then continue to sit up. Lower back down with control and repeat.

exercises.name: Toe Touch Crunch
exercises.short_description: Ab-focused crunch reaching toward toes with legs vertical to emphasize upper abdominal flexion.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back and raise legs to vertical with knees slightly soft. Reach arms up toward your toes. Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, reaching upward. Lower to the start with control and repeat.
cues: Keep low back gently pressed down

exercises.name: Flutter Kick
exercises.short_description: Alternating straight-leg kicks performed supine to challenge hip flexors and anterior core endurance.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back with legs straight and hands by your sides or under hips. Lift both legs slightly off the floor and brace your core. Alternate small up-and-down kicks without letting heels touch down. Maintain a steady rhythm.

exercises.name: Scissor Kick
exercises.short_description: Alternating leg cross-over kicks performed supine to increase anterior core and hip flexor demand.
exercises.instructions: Lie on your back and lift both legs off the floor. Brace your core and cross one leg over the other, then switch, keeping legs straight. Continue alternating while keeping your pelvis stable.
cues: Keep legs long and low only if back stays flat

exercises.name: Mountain Climber
exercises.short_description: High-plank knee drives that train core stability and hip flexion with a conditioning component.
exercises.instructions: Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders. Brace your core and drive one knee toward your chest, then switch legs in a running motion. Maintain a stable torso and keep shoulders over wrists.

exercises.name: Hip Dip (Side Plank)
exercises.short_description: Side plank variation lowering and lifting hips to target obliques and lateral core control.
exercises.instructions: Set up in a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked or staggered. Lower your hips toward the floor with control, then lift back to a straight line. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.

exercises.name: Side Plank Reach-Through
exercises.short_description: Rotational side plank drill reaching the top arm under the torso and returning to open.
exercises.instructions: Start in a side plank. Extend your top arm toward the ceiling. Rotate your torso and thread the top arm underneath your ribcage, then rotate back to the open position. Repeat for reps and switch sides.
cues: Rotate through the torso, not the hips

exercises.name: RKC Plank
exercises.short_description: High-tension forearm plank emphasizing full-body irradiation for maximum core stiffness.
exercises.instructions: Set up in a forearm plank with elbows under shoulders. Tuck pelvis slightly, squeeze glutes hard, and pull elbows toward toes without moving. Maintain maximal tension for a short timed hold.

exercises.name: Hanging Windshield Wiper
exercises.short_description: Hanging rotational core exercise moving straight legs side-to-side under control.
exercises.instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an active shoulder position. Raise legs to about hip height or higher, then rotate them to one side. Sweep through center to the other side while keeping the torso steady. Lower with control as needed and repeat.
cues: Move from the trunk, not momentum

exercises.name: Dragon Flag
exercises.short_description: Advanced anti-extension core movement lowering and raising a rigid body lever while anchored on a bench.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench and grasp behind your head for support. Lift your hips and legs so your body forms a straight line from shoulders to feet. Lower your body as a rigid lever under control, stopping before losing position, then raise back up.
cues: Keep shoulders packed and grip strong

exercises.name: Barbell Rollout
exercises.short_description: Kneeling rollout using a barbell to load anti-extension strength and shoulder control.
exercises.instructions: Load small plates on a barbell so it can roll. Kneel behind the bar and grip it shoulder-width. Brace your core and roll the bar forward, extending your arms while maintaining a neutral spine. Pull the bar back to the start under control.

exercises.name: Cable Pallof Press Hold
exercises.short_description: Anti-rotation isometric hold at full extension using a cable stack.
exercises.instructions: Stand side-on to a cable stack with the handle at chest height. Grip with both hands and step out to create tension. Press the handle straight out from your chest and hold without rotating. Return to chest and repeat, then switch sides.
cues: Exhale and brace at full extension
Don’t let the stack pull you open

exercises.name: Cable Reverse Crunch
exercises.short_description: Reverse crunch against cable resistance emphasizing posterior pelvic tilt and lower abs.
exercises.instructions: Attach ankle straps or place feet on a low cable attachment while lying on a bench or on the floor facing away from the stack. Start with hips and knees bent. Curl your pelvis up, bringing knees toward chest against the cable. Lower slowly to the start without losing control.
cues: Initiate with a pelvic curl, not leg swing

exercises.name: Machine Ab Crunch
exercises.short_description: Seated or kneeling abdominal crunch performed on an ab crunch machine for consistent loading.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the machine to fit your torso and set the desired weight. Sit or kneel as designed and grip the handles. Brace, then crunch by bringing ribs toward pelvis through spinal flexion. Pause, then return under control without letting the stack slam.

exercises.name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.short_description: A dumbbell pressing variation on a decline bench emphasizing the lower chest and triceps.
exercises.instructions: Set a bench to a slight decline and lie back with dumbbells over your chest. Retract your shoulder blades and plant your feet. Lower the dumbbells under control to the sides of your chest with elbows angled 30–60 degrees. Press the dumbbells up and slightly together to full elbow extension without losing upper-back tightness.
cues: Shoulders down and back on the bench

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press (Standing)
exercises.short_description: A standing overhead press with dumbbells emphasizing shoulders and triceps while demanding trunk stability.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at shoulder height with elbows slightly forward. Brace your core and glutes. Press the dumbbells overhead until elbows lock out softly. Lower back to the start under control without leaning back.
cues: Press straight up; avoid flaring elbows wide

exercises.name: Seated Barbell Overhead Press
exercises.short_description: A seated overhead barbell press emphasizing shoulders and triceps with reduced lower-body contribution.
exercises.instructions: Set an upright bench and sit with the bar at the upper chest/clavicle. Brace your trunk, keep forearms vertical, and press the bar overhead. Move your head slightly back as the bar passes, then finish with the bar stacked over midfoot. Lower to the upper chest under control.
cues: Press up and slightly back to finish over shoulders
Control the descent to the chest

exercises.name: Seated Machine Shoulder Press
exercises.short_description: A guided overhead press on a machine for shoulder and triceps development.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat so the handles start around chin/upper-chest height. Grip the handles and set your shoulders down and back. Press overhead to near lockout, then lower under control to the start position.
cues: Keep forearms vertical through the press
Keep your back in contact with the pad

exercises.name: Cable Crossover (High-to-Low)
exercises.short_description: A cable fly variation pulling from high to low to target the lower/overall chest with constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Set pulleys high and take a staggered stance. With a slight elbow bend, bring the handles down and across your body toward the midline near the lower chest/upper abs. Pause and squeeze, then return slowly until you feel a stretch without losing shoulder position.
cues: Keep a soft bend in the elbows
Let the chest move the load, not the hands

exercises.name: Cable Crossover (Low-to-High)
exercises.short_description: A cable fly variation pulling from low to high to emphasize the upper chest fibers.
exercises.instructions: Set pulleys low and take a stable staggered stance. With slight elbow bend, sweep the handles up and in toward upper chest/face level, finishing with hands close together. Pause, then return slowly to the start while maintaining shoulder control.
cues: Keep ribs down and chest proud
Don’t turn it into a shoulder raise

exercises.name: Pec Deck Fly
exercises.short_description: A machine fly that isolates the chest with a stable path and constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat so your elbows are roughly in line with mid-chest. Place forearms on pads or grip handles depending on the machine. Bring arms together in front of the chest, squeeze, then return slowly until you feel a stretch.
cues: Move from the chest, not the hands
Don’t let elbows drift too low

exercises.name: Cable Chest Press (Standing)
exercises.short_description: A standing press using cables to train horizontal pressing with core stability and constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Set cables to chest height and take a staggered stance facing away from the machine. Start with handles near the chest, elbows slightly tucked. Brace your trunk and press forward until arms extend. Return under control without letting shoulders roll forward.

exercises.name: Svend Press
exercises.short_description: A chest-focused press by squeezing dumbbells together and pressing forward to increase pec activation.
exercises.instructions: Stand or sit holding two dumbbells pressed together at chest height. Squeeze them together hard. Press the dumbbells straight forward until elbows extend, keeping them squeezed together. Return to chest under control.
cues: Crush the dumbbells together the whole time

exercises.name: Push-Up (Diamond)
exercises.short_description: A narrow-hand push-up emphasizing the triceps and inner chest.
exercises.instructions: Start in a plank with hands close together under the chest, forming a diamond/triangle shape with thumbs and index fingers. Keep body straight and brace the core. Lower until chest is near hands, then press back up to full lockout.
cues: Keep elbows tracking back, not flared wide

exercises.name: Push-Up (Decline)
exercises.short_description: A feet-elevated push-up increasing load and emphasizing upper chest and shoulders.
exercises.instructions: Place feet on a bench and hands on the floor slightly wider than shoulder width. Brace your core and keep a straight line from shoulders to heels. Lower chest toward the floor, then press back up to full extension.
cues: Press up strongly and lock out

exercises.name: Handstand Push-Up (Wall-Assisted)
exercises.short_description: A vertical pressing bodyweight exercise using a wall for balance, emphasizing shoulders and triceps.
exercises.instructions: Kick up into a handstand with heels on a wall and hands shoulder-width apart. Brace your core and keep ribs down. Lower your head toward the floor by bending elbows, then press back up to full elbow extension.
cues: Grip the floor and spread fingers

exercises.name: Pike Push-Up
exercises.short_description: A bodyweight overhead-press pattern from a pike position to target shoulders and triceps.
exercises.instructions: Start in a push-up position then walk feet toward hands to form a pike with hips high. Hands shoulder-width apart. Bend elbows to lower head toward the floor between hands, then press back up.
cues: Aim head slightly forward between hands

exercises.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
exercises.short_description: An isolation movement for the lateral delts, building shoulder width and pressing support.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at your sides. With a slight elbow bend, raise the dumbbells out to the sides to shoulder height. Pause briefly, then lower under control to your sides.

exercises.name: Cable Lateral Raise
exercises.short_description: A lateral raise using a cable for more consistent tension across the range of motion.
exercises.instructions: Set a low pulley and stand side-on to the stack holding the handle with the outside hand. Start with hand across the body near the hip. Raise the arm out to the side to shoulder height with a slight elbow bend, then lower slowly.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
exercises.short_description: An anterior delt isolation movement supporting overhead and horizontal pressing strength.
exercises.instructions: Stand with dumbbells in front of thighs, palms facing in or down. Keeping a soft elbow bend, raise one or both dumbbells to shoulder height. Lower under control back to the start.

exercises.name: Overhead Triceps Extension (Dumbbell)
exercises.short_description: A triceps isolation exercise performed overhead to emphasize the long head of the triceps.
exercises.instructions: Stand or sit holding a dumbbell with both hands overhead. Keep elbows pointing forward and close to the head. Bend elbows to lower the dumbbell behind your head, then extend elbows to return to full lockout.

exercises.name: Overhead Triceps Extension (Cable Rope)
exercises.short_description: A cable overhead triceps extension using a rope to train the triceps long head with constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley. Face away from the stack and bring the rope behind your head with elbows bent. Brace your core and extend elbows until arms are straight overhead. Return under control to the stretched position.
cues: Keep elbows fixed and close to head
Spread the rope slightly at lockout

exercises.name: Triceps Dip (Bench Dip)
exercises.short_description: A bodyweight dip variation using a bench to emphasize triceps through elbow extension.
exercises.instructions: Place hands on a bench behind you with fingers forward and legs extended (or knees bent). Lower hips by bending elbows until upper arms are near parallel to the floor, then press back up by extending elbows.
cues: Keep shoulders down; avoid excessive forward shoulder roll
Use a range that feels good on shoulders

exercises.name: Barbell Split Squat
exercises.short_description: A stationary lunge variation performed with a barbell for lower-body strength and stability.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on your upper back. Take a split stance with one foot forward and one back, torso tall. Lower straight down until the front thigh is near parallel and the back knee is close to the floor. Drive through the front midfoot to stand, keeping hips square. Complete reps then switch sides.
cues: Keep torso tall and ribs down
Drop straight down—don’t step forward/back during reps
Drive through midfoot/heel on the front leg

exercises.name: Dumbbell Split Squat
exercises.short_description: A stationary split squat using dumbbells for unilateral leg strength and balance.
exercises.instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides. Take a split stance and brace your core. Lower straight down until the front thigh approaches parallel and the back knee nears the floor. Push through the front foot to return to standing. Repeat, then switch legs.
cues: Keep weight centered over the front foot

exercises.name: Dumbbell Reverse Lunge
exercises.short_description: A reverse lunge performed with dumbbells to build unilateral leg strength with reduced knee stress.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at your sides. Step one foot back and lower until the front thigh is near parallel and the back knee is close to the floor. Drive through the front foot to return to standing. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
cues: Step back far enough for a vertical front shin
Keep chest up and core braced
Push the floor away to stand

exercises.name: Curtsy Lunge
exercises.short_description: A lunge stepping behind and across to emphasize glutes and hip stabilizers.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width. Step one leg behind and across the other, lowering into a lunge while keeping hips facing forward. Press through the front foot to return to standing. Repeat then switch sides.
cues: Keep front knee aligned with toes
Control depth based on hip comfort

exercises.name: Lateral Lunge
exercises.short_description: A side-to-side lunge to train frontal-plane leg strength and mobility.
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width. Step out to the side and sit hips back over the stepping leg while the other leg stays straighter. Keep the foot flat and knee tracking over toes. Push off the stepping leg to return to center. Alternate sides.
cues: Hinge back with hips, not just the knee
Drive the floor away to return

exercises.name: Dumbbell Step-Up
exercises.short_description: A loaded step-up using dumbbells to build unilateral leg strength and control.
exercises.instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides and face a stable box/bench. Place one foot fully on the surface. Drive through that foot to stand on top, bringing the other foot up under control. Step down with control and repeat for reps, then switch legs.
cues: Keep the whole foot on the box
Drive through the lead leg—avoid pushing off the bottom leg

exercises.name: Barbell Step-Up
exercises.short_description: A step-up performed with a barbell to increase loading and unilateral leg strength.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on your upper back and stand facing a stable box/bench. Place one foot fully on the surface. Drive through the lead leg to stand on top. Step down with control and repeat for reps before switching legs.
cues: Use a box height that keeps control and knee comfort
Avoid bouncing off the floor between reps

exercises.name: Single-Leg Romanian Deadlift (Dumbbell)
exercises.short_description: A unilateral hip hinge with dumbbells to build posterior-chain strength and balance.
exercises.instructions: Hold one or two dumbbells. Stand on one leg with a soft knee. Hinge at the hips, sending the free leg back as your torso leans forward. Lower until you feel a hamstring stretch while keeping a flat back. Drive the hip forward to return to standing. Repeat then switch sides.
cues: Hips stay square to the floor
Reach the free heel back to counterbalance
Keep back neutral and neck long

exercises.name: Single-Leg Deadlift (Kettlebell)
exercises.short_description: A kettlebell single-leg hinge emphasizing posterior-chain strength and stability.
exercises.instructions: Hold a kettlebell in one hand (optionally the opposite hand from the stance leg). Stand on one leg with a slight knee bend. Hinge at the hips, lowering the kettlebell toward the floor while extending the free leg behind you. Return by driving the hip forward and standing tall. Switch sides after reps.
cues: Keep shoulders square and lats engaged
Move from the hip—minimal knee bend

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swing
exercises.short_description: A powerful hip-hinge movement using a kettlebell to train posterior chain and explosive hip extension.
exercises.instructions: Start with the kettlebell on the floor slightly in front of you. Hinge at the hips to grip it, hike it back between your legs, then snap your hips forward to swing it to chest height (Russian swing). Let it float, then guide it back into the hinge and repeat.
cues: Explode with hips; arms stay relaxed
Keep ribs down and spine neutral
Bell should feel weightless at the top

exercises.name: Barbell Hip Hinge (Rack Pull)
exercises.short_description: A partial deadlift from an elevated bar position to emphasize hip hinge strength and lockout.
exercises.instructions: Set the bar on safeties/blocks around knee to mid-shin height. Stand with midfoot under the bar, brace, and hinge to grip the bar. Pull by driving feet into the floor and extending hips and knees to stand tall. Lower under control back to the pins.
cues: Finish with hips through, not hyperextension

exercises.name: Deadlift (Machine)
exercises.short_description: A deadlift pattern performed on a machine to train hip hinge with guided resistance.
exercises.instructions: Set up on the deadlift machine with feet under hips and hands on handles. Brace your core and hinge to the start position. Drive through feet to extend hips and knees to stand tall. Lower under control to the start position and repeat.

exercises.name: Seated Leg Curl (Machine)
exercises.short_description: A hamstring isolation exercise performed seated on a leg curl machine.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat and pad so the roller sits just above your heels and knees align with the machine’s pivot. Brace your torso against the pad. Curl the weight down by bending your knees, pause briefly, then return under control.
cues: Keep hips glued to the seat
Control the eccentric—don’t let it snap up
Set range to avoid knee discomfort

exercises.name: Lying Leg Curl (Machine)
exercises.short_description: A prone hamstring curl on a machine to isolate knee flexion strength.
exercises.instructions: Lie face down on the machine with the roller pad just above your heels. Hold the handles and keep hips down. Curl the pad toward your glutes, pause, then lower slowly to the start.

exercises.name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
exercises.short_description: A bodyweight hamstring strength exercise emphasizing eccentric control.
exercises.instructions: Kneel with ankles secured under a sturdy anchor or held by a partner. Keep hips extended and torso straight. Slowly lower your body toward the floor by extending the knees, resisting with hamstrings. Catch yourself with hands as needed and push lightly to return to start.
cues: Keep a straight line from knees to head
Use assistance as needed to control range

exercises.name: Sissy Squat
exercises.short_description: A quad-dominant squat pattern with knees traveling forward and torso leaning back.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall and hold a support lightly if needed. Rise onto the balls of your feet slightly as you let knees travel forward and lean torso back, keeping hips extended. Lower to a comfortable depth, then contract quads to return to standing.
cues: Knees travel forward in line with toes
Use support and small range to start

exercises.name: Belt Squat (Machine)
exercises.short_description: A squat pattern loaded through a belt to reduce spinal loading while training legs heavily.
exercises.instructions: Set the belt and attach it to the machine. Stand on the platform with feet shoulder-width. Brace and squat down until thighs are near parallel (or comfortable depth), then drive up through midfoot to stand. Repeat for reps.
cues: Stay braced even though load is on hips
Keep feet rooted—don’t shift to toes

exercises.name: Smith Machine Reverse Lunge
exercises.short_description: A reverse lunge under a Smith machine bar for guided loading and stability.
exercises.instructions: Set the bar at upper-back height and step under it. Stand tall and brace. Step one foot back and lower into a lunge, then drive through the front foot to stand. Repeat for reps then switch sides.
cues: Find a stance that keeps balance and front knee comfortable

exercises.name: Cable Pull-Through
exercises.short_description: A cable hip hinge emphasizing glute-driven hip extension with constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Set a low cable with a rope attachment. Face away from the stack and hold the rope between your legs. Step forward to create tension. Hinge at hips, letting hands travel back, then drive hips forward to stand tall and squeeze glutes. Repeat.
cues: Squeeze glutes at lockout without leaning back
Keep arms long; hips do the work

exercises.name: Barbell Walking Lunge (In-Place)
exercises.short_description: An in-place lunge with a barbell to build unilateral leg strength without traveling forward.
exercises.instructions: Place a barbell on your upper back and take a split stance. Lower into a lunge until the back knee approaches the floor, then drive through the front foot to return to the start position without stepping. Complete reps and switch sides.
cues: Stay balanced with a stable split stance

exercises.name: Assault Bike Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous effort on an air bike at a sustainable pace.
exercises.instructions: Set the assault bike seat height so your knee is slightly bent at the bottom of the pedal stroke. Start pedaling and moving the handles smoothly. Set a target pace (watts/RPM/calories per hour) you can maintain for the full duration. Breathe rhythmically and keep effort consistent.

exercises.name: Rower Sprints (Max Effort)
exercises.short_description: Short, maximal rowing efforts with full recovery or programmed rest.
exercises.instructions: Set damper/drag factor to a moderate setting you can sprint with good form. Start from the catch position, drive hard through the legs, then open the hips and finish with an arm pull. Recover by sending arms away, hinging forward, then sliding the seat. Row hard for the prescribed sprint time/distance, then rest or easy paddle before repeating.
cues: Legs first, then hips, then arms
Stay tall—don’t collapse at the finish
Explode on the drive; controlled recovery

exercises.name: Bike Tabata (Airdyne/Assault Bike)
exercises.short_description: Classic 20s all-out / 10s rest repeated for 8 rounds on an air bike.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Set a timer for 8 rounds of 20 seconds work and 10 seconds rest. Sprint hard for 20 seconds, then fully stop or pedal very lightly for 10 seconds. Repeat for all rounds, then cool down.
cues: Go hard but keep breathing under control
Stay seated to sustain power across rounds
Track output; aim for consistent rounds

exercises.name: Elliptical Reverse Intervals
exercises.short_description: Interval training on an elliptical with backward pedaling to shift emphasis and vary stimulus.
exercises.instructions: Select a resistance and ramp/incline you can handle with stable posture. Pedal backward for the work interval at a challenging pace. Recover by lowering resistance and pedaling easier (still backward or switch forward). Repeat for prescribed rounds.
cues: Keep hips square and torso tall
Drive through full foot; don’t bounce
Use resistance to create load, not sloppy speed

exercises.name: Stair Climber Steady-State (Low-Impact)
exercises.short_description: Continuous stair climbing at a steady pace with minimal hand support.
exercises.instructions: Step onto the stair climber and select a sustainable step rate. Keep hands lightly on the rails only for balance. Maintain a consistent pace for the duration. Focus on full-foot contact and upright posture.
cues: Stay tall; avoid leaning on the rails
Step through the whole foot, not just toes

exercises.name: Uphill Treadmill Run Intervals
exercises.short_description: Run intervals on a treadmill at moderate-to-steep incline for leg-focused conditioning.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy jogging. Set incline (e.g., 4–10%) and a challenging running speed. Run for the work interval, then reduce speed and/or incline for recovery. Repeat for prescribed rounds and cool down.
cues: Shorten stride slightly as incline increases
Stay tall; don’t hinge at the waist
Let arms drive rhythm with relaxed shoulders

exercises.name: Stationary Bike Cadence Pyramids
exercises.short_description: Structured bike intervals that ramp cadence up and down while keeping form and control.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Choose a moderate resistance. Increase cadence each step of the pyramid (e.g., 70→80→90→100 RPM), hold briefly, then step back down. Recover between pyramids as needed and repeat for the planned duration.
cues: Spin smooth—avoid bouncing in the saddle
Adjust resistance so cadence changes are purposeful

exercises.name: Ski Erg Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous SkiErg work at a conversational-to-moderate pace.
exercises.instructions: Set the damper to a moderate setting. Start tall with handles overhead. Pull down by engaging lats and core, hinging slightly and finishing with hands near hips. Return smoothly overhead and repeat at a steady pace for the full duration.
cues: Initiate with lats and core, not just arms
Keep ribs down; avoid overextending low back

exercises.name: Arc Trainer Steady-State
exercises.short_description: Continuous effort on an Arc Trainer at a steady pace for low-impact aerobic work.
exercises.instructions: Select a resistance and incline you can maintain while breathing steadily. Step on and find a smooth stride. Maintain consistent cadence and posture for the planned duration.
cues: Push through the platform with full foot contact
Choose settings that keep effort steady, not spiky

exercises.name: Treadmill Progression Run
exercises.short_description: A treadmill run that gradually increases pace from easy to hard over set time or distance.
exercises.instructions: Start with an easy pace for 5–10 minutes. Increase speed slightly every few minutes while maintaining relaxed form. Finish at a challenging but controlled effort, then cool down at an easy pace.
cues: Keep breathing controlled as speed rises
Avoid overstriding; keep quick, light steps

exercises.name: Rowing Machine EMOM Calories
exercises.short_description: Every minute on the minute, row a set number of calories, resting with remaining time.
exercises.instructions: Choose a calorie target you can hit while preserving form (e.g., 10–20 cals). Start the clock and row hard to reach the target, then rest until the next minute begins. Repeat for the planned number of minutes.
cues: Pick a target that allows consistent rounds

exercises.name: Bike Erg Intervals (Concept2 BikeErg)
exercises.short_description: Structured hard/easy intervals on a BikeErg focusing on power output consistency.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Set damper/resistance and choose interval format (e.g., 10x1:00 hard / 1:00 easy). Ride the hard portions at a challenging watt target, then spin easy for recovery. Cool down.
cues: Hold steady watts instead of sprinting then fading
Keep upper body quiet and relaxed
Use gearing/damper to match your cadence strengths

exercises.name: Elliptical Incline Intervals
exercises.short_description: Elliptical intervals using incline/ramp changes to increase metabolic demand.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at low incline and easy pace. For work intervals, raise incline/ramp and increase pace. For recovery, lower incline and slow down. Repeat for the planned number of rounds.
cues: Use incline to load glutes; keep posture upright

exercises.name: Stair Climber Sprint Intervals
exercises.short_description: Short, hard bursts on a stair climber with recovery periods for HIIT conditioning.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 3–5 minutes at an easy step rate. Increase to a very hard step rate for the sprint interval. Reduce step rate for recovery. Repeat for prescribed rounds, then cool down.
cues: Stay tall; don’t hinge or hang on rails
Recover enough to keep sprint quality high

exercises.name: Treadmill Walk-Run Intervals
exercises.short_description: Alternating bouts of running and brisk walking on a treadmill for accessible interval conditioning.
exercises.instructions: Warm up with easy walking. Set a run pace you can maintain with good form for the work interval, then switch to a brisk walk for recovery. Repeat for the planned duration and cool down.
cues: Pick a run pace you can repeat consistently
Keep walk recovery purposeful, not a complete stop
Maintain relaxed arm swing and steady breathing

exercises.name: Rowing Machine 30:30 Intervals
exercises.short_description: Alternating 30 seconds hard and 30 seconds easy on a rowing erg for repeated high output.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Row hard for 30 seconds, then row easy for 30 seconds. Repeat for the prescribed number of rounds, maintaining strong technique throughout.
cues: Hard intervals: powerful leg drive, quick hands
Easy intervals: long strokes, controlled breathing
Keep stroke rate appropriate—don’t just flail faster

exercises.name: Stationary Bike Sprint Intervals
exercises.short_description: Short, high-power bike sprints with recovery pedaling between efforts.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes including a few fast spins. Choose a resistance that allows high power without bouncing. Sprint hard for the work interval, then pedal easy for recovery. Repeat for prescribed rounds.
cues: Add enough resistance to create power
Stay seated if possible to keep form consistent
Full recovery between sprints improves output

exercises.name: Assault Bike Power Intervals (Calories)
exercises.short_description: Repeated hard efforts on an air bike using calories as the work target.
exercises.instructions: Warm up thoroughly. Choose a calorie target per interval (e.g., 8–20 cals). Sprint to the target, then rest a set time or until breathing is under control. Repeat for the planned number of intervals.
cues: Attack the first 5–10 seconds, then settle into pace
Stop early if form collapses or output crashes

exercises.name: Elliptical Tabata
exercises.short_description: 20 seconds hard / 10 seconds easy repeated for 8 rounds on an elliptical.
exercises.instructions: Warm up 5–10 minutes. Set resistance/incline so your hard efforts are challenging but controlled. Perform 8 rounds of 20 seconds hard and 10 seconds easy. Cool down afterwards.
cues: Increase resistance slightly to prevent sloppy spinning
Aim for similar output each round

exercises.name: Stair Climber Pyramid Intervals
exercises.short_description: Stair climber intervals that build step rate up and down in a pyramid for varied intensity.
exercises.instructions: Warm up at an easy step rate. Increase step rate each interval step (or increase duration), then decrease back down. Use easy stepping between steps as needed. Repeat pyramids for the planned session length.
cues: Stay in control as speed rises
Use consistent step depth and rhythm

exercises.name: Treadmill Incline Power Walk (Steady-State)
exercises.short_description: Brisk incline walking at a steady pace for low-impact aerobic and leg-focused conditioning.
exercises.instructions: Set incline (e.g., 6–15%) and a brisk walking speed. Walk continuously for the planned duration. Adjust speed/incline to keep effort steady without needing to jog.
cues: Stand tall; avoid holding the rails
Take shorter steps as incline increases
Drive arms naturally and breathe rhythmically

exercises.name: Single-Arm Cable Row
exercises.short_description: Unilateral cable row emphasizing lat and mid-back with consistent tension.
exercises.instructions: Set a cable handle at about navel height. Stand or sit braced with a neutral spine and grasp the handle with one hand. Start with the shoulder slightly protracted. Pull the elbow back toward the hip/ribcage while keeping the torso steady. Pause briefly, then return under control to full reach without losing posture.
cues: Brace ribs down and keep torso square
Lead with the elbow; avoid shrugging
Pull to hip for more lat bias
Control the reach at the bottom

exercises.name: Standing Cable Row
exercises.short_description: Cable row performed standing to challenge trunk stability while training back and biceps.
exercises.instructions: Set a cable handle at mid-torso height. Stand in an athletic stance with soft knees and a braced trunk. Begin with arms extended and shoulders forward slightly. Row the handle toward the lower ribs while keeping chest tall and hips square. Return slowly to full extension.
cues: Don’t lean back to finish reps
Shoulders down and back as you row
Squeeze between shoulder blades at peak

exercises.name: Smith Machine Bent-Over Row
exercises.short_description: Bent-over row on a Smith machine for a fixed bar path and stable loading.
exercises.instructions: Set the Smith bar around knee height. Hinge at the hips to a strong torso angle and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width. Pull the bar toward the lower ribs/upper abdomen, pause, then lower under control to full arm extension.
cues: Keep shins mostly vertical and back flat

exercises.name: Machine Seated Row (Plate-Loaded)
exercises.short_description: Plate-loaded seated row emphasizing mid-back and lats with guided stability.
exercises.instructions: Adjust the seat and chest/foot position so handles start with arms extended. Keep chest tall and brace your trunk. Pull handles toward the torso, squeeze the back, then return slowly to the start position.
cues: Keep shoulders out of your ears
Drive elbows back and slightly down

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Machine Row
exercises.short_description: Chest-supported row machine to isolate back and reduce lower-back loading.
exercises.instructions: Set the chest pad so you can fully reach the handles without rounding. Brace against the pad and start with arms extended. Row the handles back toward the body, pause, then return with control.
cues: Keep chest glued to the pad
Finish by pulling elbows behind you, not shrugging
Full stretch without losing shoulder control

exercises.name: Cable Rear Delt Row
exercises.short_description: High-elbow cable row emphasizing rear delts and upper back.
exercises.instructions: Set a cable handle at upper-chest height. Stand tall and grab with a pronated or neutral grip. Pull the handle toward the upper chest/neck line with elbows flared out. Pause, then return to full reach under control.
cues: Keep neck long; don’t jut chin forward

exercises.name: Ring Chin-Up
exercises.short_description: Chin-up on rings allowing wrist rotation and a strong biceps/lat emphasis.
exercises.instructions: Set rings at a height you can hang freely. Grip rings with palms facing you and start from a dead hang. Pull until the rings reach the sides of your chest or chin clears hands. Lower to a full hang with control.
cues: Keep ribs down and legs slightly in front
Use a full dead hang each rep

exercises.name: Ring Pull-Up (Neutral Grip)
exercises.short_description: Pull-up on rings using a neutral grip to emphasize lats with joint-friendly wrist position.
exercises.instructions: Hang from rings with palms facing each other. Start in a dead hang with shoulders set. Pull your chest up toward the rings until chin passes the hands. Lower under control to full extension.
cues: Keep shoulders packed at the bottom

exercises.name: Towel Pull-Up
exercises.short_description: Pull-up gripping towels to increase forearm and grip demand while training lats and biceps.
exercises.instructions: Drape two towels evenly over a pull-up bar and grip one towel in each hand. Start from a dead hang. Pull up until chin clears the hands, then lower to full extension with control.
cues: Crush the towels and keep wrists neutral
Use full range and controlled tempo

exercises.name: Band Lat Pulldown (Anchored)
exercises.short_description: Resistance-band lat pulldown anchored overhead to mimic a pulldown pattern.
exercises.instructions: Anchor a band overhead. Kneel or sit beneath the anchor and grip the band ends. Start with arms overhead and shoulders set. Pull elbows down to the sides until hands reach upper chest level, then return slowly overhead.
cues: Keep ribs down; don’t hyperextend low back
Pause and squeeze lats at bottom

exercises.name: Kneeling Cable Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Lat pulldown performed kneeling to reduce body English and reinforce bracing.
exercises.instructions: Set a high cable with a bar or handles. Kneel facing the stack and brace your trunk. Start with arms overhead. Pull the handle down toward the upper chest while keeping torso tall. Return under control to full stretch.

exercises.name: Machine Lat Pulldown (Plate-Loaded)
exercises.short_description: Plate-loaded pulldown machine for lats with a guided path and stable setup.
exercises.instructions: Adjust seat and thigh pad so you’re secured. Grip the handles and start with arms extended. Pull down toward the upper chest, pause, then return slowly to full extension.
cues: Lead with elbows; keep wrists stacked

exercises.name: Close-Grip Cable Lat Pulldown
exercises.short_description: Lat pulldown using a close grip to bias lats through a strong elbow drive.
exercises.instructions: Set a pulldown station with a close-grip attachment. Sit secured under the thigh pad. Start with arms extended overhead. Pull the handle to upper chest and squeeze lats, then return under control.
cues: Keep chest tall without excessive lean
Drive elbows down close to ribs

exercises.name: Cable Lat Pullover (Straight-Arm)
exercises.short_description: Straight-arm pullover on a cable to isolate the lats with minimal elbow flexion.
exercises.instructions: Set a high cable with a straight bar or rope. Stand with a slight hip hinge and arms nearly straight. Pull the handle down in an arc toward thighs while keeping elbows softly bent. Return slowly to the start with a controlled stretch.
cues: Lock ribs down; avoid lumbar extension

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover (On Bench)
exercises.short_description: Pullover using a dumbbell on a bench to train lats through shoulder extension.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench with head supported and feet planted. Hold a dumbbell over the chest with both hands. Keeping a slight elbow bend, lower the weight back until you feel a lat/chest stretch. Pull the dumbbell back over the chest by driving the upper arms down.
cues: Keep ribs down; don’t flare excessively
Move at the shoulder, not the elbows

exercises.name: Cable Curl (Straight Bar)
exercises.short_description: Cable biceps curl with a straight bar for constant tension through the range.
exercises.instructions: Attach a straight bar to a low cable. Stand tall with elbows close to sides. Curl the bar up by flexing the elbows without swinging. Squeeze at the top, then lower slowly to full extension.

exercises.name: EZ-Bar Curl
exercises.short_description: Biceps curl using an EZ bar to reduce wrist strain while loading the elbow flexors.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding an EZ bar with a comfortable supinated grip on the angled sections. Keep elbows near the torso. Curl to shoulder height, pause, then lower under control to full extension.
cues: Keep shoulders quiet; move only at elbows

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse-Grip Curl
exercises.short_description: Reverse-grip barbell curl emphasizing forearms and brachialis with biceps assistance.
exercises.instructions: Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip at hip width. Keep elbows close to the body. Curl the bar up to mid-chest while keeping wrists neutral. Lower slowly to full extension.

exercises.name: Cable Hammer Curl (Rope)
exercises.short_description: Neutral-grip cable curl using a rope to target brachialis and forearms with constant tension.
exercises.instructions: Attach a rope to a low cable. Stand tall with elbows near sides and palms facing each other. Curl the rope up, keeping neutral grip throughout. Pause, then lower slowly to full elbow extension.
cues: Keep elbows fixed at your sides
Finish with knuckles up, not wrists bent

exercises.name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
exercises.short_description: Single-arm or bilateral dumbbell preacher curl to isolate the biceps with strict form.
exercises.instructions: Set an incline bench or preacher pad so upper arms rest firmly. Hold a dumbbell and start near full extension without locking out hard. Curl up without lifting the upper arm off the pad. Pause, then lower slowly to a controlled stretch.
cues: Don’t bounce out of the bottom

exercises.name: Dumbbell Drag Curl
exercises.short_description: Curl variation where the dumbbells stay close to the torso to reduce shoulder involvement.
exercises.instructions: Stand with dumbbells at your sides, palms forward. Curl by dragging the dumbbells up along the front of your torso, keeping elbows moving slightly back. Pause at the top, then lower slowly along the same path.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press (Neutral Grip)
exercises.short_description: Flat dumbbell press using a neutral (palms-in) grip to emphasize triceps and shoulder-friendly pressing.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand held over the chest, palms facing each other. Retract and depress the shoulder blades and keep feet planted. Lower the dumbbells with elbows tucked ~30–45° from the torso until they reach the sides of the chest. Press back to lockout, keeping wrists stacked over elbows and the bells over the mid-chest.
cues: Press up and slightly in toward midline

exercises.name: Incline Machine Chest Press
exercises.short_description: Seated/lying incline pressing on a machine to target upper chest with stable resistance.
exercises.instructions: Adjust seat/bench so the handles start near upper chest level. Grip handles and brace the torso against the pad. Press the handles forward/up along the machine path until elbows are near lockout without shrugging. Control the return until handles are back near the upper chest.
cues: Keep chest tall and ribs down

exercises.name: Hammer Strength Chest Press
exercises.short_description: Plate-loaded chest press machine emphasizing heavy, stable horizontal pressing.
exercises.instructions: Set the seat so handles align with mid-chest. Grip the handles and pin upper back to the pad. Press the handles forward to near lockout. Lower under control until you feel a comfortable stretch across the chest, keeping elbows slightly tucked.
cues: Press through the heel of the hand
Don’t bounce out of the bottom

exercises.name: Machine Pec Fly (Standing / Rear-Entry)
exercises.short_description: Chest fly on a pec deck-style machine performed standing to emphasize pec adduction.
exercises.instructions: Set the arms so elbows/forearms contact the pads comfortably. Stand tall with a slight forward lean and brace the core. Bring the pads/handles together in front of the chest by squeezing the pecs. Pause briefly, then return under control to a mild stretch without letting shoulders roll forward.
cues: Move from the chest, not the hands

exercises.name: Dumbbell Pullover (Bench)
exercises.short_description: Arc-style pullover emphasizing chest and serratus with assistance from lats and triceps.
exercises.instructions: Lie perpendicular across a bench with upper back supported (or lie lengthwise). Hold one dumbbell with both hands over the chest with a slight elbow bend. Lower the weight in an arc behind the head until you feel a controlled stretch. Pull the dumbbell back to above the chest without changing elbow angle.
cues: Move through the shoulders, not the low back

exercises.name: Standing Cable Chest Fly
exercises.short_description: Cable fly from a standing position for constant tension through chest adduction.
exercises.instructions: Set cables at mid-chest height and grab handles. Step forward into a staggered stance with a slight forward lean. With a soft elbow bend, bring hands together in front of the chest. Pause, then return under control until you feel a pec stretch without losing shoulder position.
cues: Don’t let elbows drift too far back

exercises.name: Cable Chest Press (Single-Arm)
exercises.short_description: Single-arm cable press that trains chest pressing while resisting rotation.
exercises.instructions: Set a cable at chest height. Stand sideways to the stack, grip with the outside hand, and step out to create tension. Start with the hand near the chest and elbow tucked. Press straight forward to full extension while keeping hips and shoulders square. Return slowly to the start.

exercises.name: Barbell Push Press
exercises.short_description: Overhead press with a leg drive to move heavier loads and train power.
exercises.instructions: Set the bar in the front rack with feet shoulder-width. Take a short dip by bending knees and hips slightly while staying upright. Drive forcefully through the legs to start the bar upward, then finish by pressing overhead to lockout. Lower the bar back to the front rack under control and reset each rep.
cues: Lock ribs down at the top

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Overhead Press (Neutral Grip)
exercises.short_description: Seated dumbbell press with palms-in grip for a shoulder-friendly vertical press.
exercises.instructions: Sit on an upright bench with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing each other. Brace the core and keep glutes on the bench. Press the dumbbells overhead until elbows extend without shrugging. Lower to the start with forearms vertical.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Z Press
exercises.short_description: Seated-on-floor overhead press emphasizing core control and shoulder strength.
exercises.instructions: Sit on the floor with legs straight out and torso tall. Hold dumbbells at shoulder height. Brace the core and press overhead to lockout without leaning back. Lower under control to the shoulders, maintaining an upright posture.

exercises.name: Barbell Z Press
exercises.short_description: Floor-seated barbell overhead press demanding strict torso position and mobility.
exercises.instructions: Sit on the floor with legs straight and bar in the front rack (from the floor or pins). Brace and keep the torso upright. Press the bar overhead to lockout, then lower back to the front rack under control without leaning back.
cues: Press head through at the top
Elbows slightly in front at start

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Overhead Press (Standing)
exercises.short_description: Unilateral overhead press that challenges shoulder stability and anti-rotation core strength.
exercises.instructions: Stand tall holding a dumbbell at one shoulder. Brace the core and squeeze glutes. Press the dumbbell overhead to lockout without leaning or rotating. Lower to the shoulder under control and repeat, then switch sides.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Strict Press
exercises.short_description: Strict overhead press with a kettlebell emphasizing shoulder stability and grip.
exercises.instructions: Clean the kettlebell to the rack position (or start racked). Stand tall and brace. Press the bell overhead to lockout, keeping the forearm vertical and wrist neutral. Lower back to rack under control.
cues: Keep elbow close at the rack
Punch to lockout at the top

exercises.name: Barbell Pin Press (Bench Press from Pins)
exercises.short_description: Bench press starting from dead stop on pins to build strength off the chest or midrange.
exercises.instructions: Set safety pins in a rack so the bar rests at the desired height above your chest while you lie on a bench. Unrack or start with the bar on the pins. Get tight, then press from a dead stop to lockout. Lower back to the pins with control and fully settle the bar before the next rep.
cues: Pause dead on the pins each rep
Drive feet and keep upper back set
Press straight up over the shoulder line

exercises.name: Spoto Press (Barbell)
exercises.short_description: Paused bench press variation hovering just above the chest to build control and tension.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench and unrack the bar like a normal bench press. Lower the bar until it is 1–2 cm above the chest and pause briefly while maintaining tightness. Press to lockout. Repeat without touching the chest.
cues: Drive back toward the rack on the press

exercises.name: JM Press (Barbell)
exercises.short_description: Hybrid of close-grip bench and skull crusher to target triceps strength for pressing.
exercises.instructions: Lie on a bench and unrack a barbell with a close grip. Lower the bar by bending elbows and letting it travel toward the upper chest/neck area while keeping upper arms relatively fixed. Stop when you feel strong triceps tension, then press back up by extending the elbows.

exercises.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
exercises.short_description: Triceps isolation using a cable for constant tension through elbow extension.
exercises.instructions: Set a low cable with a single handle. Hinge forward with a flat back and bring upper arm close to the torso. Start with elbow bent and upper arm fixed. Extend the elbow to straighten the arm behind you, then return slowly without letting the upper arm swing.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Triceps Kickback
exercises.short_description: Triceps isolation kickback emphasizing peak contraction at elbow lockout.
exercises.instructions: Brace one hand and knee on a bench with torso hinged forward. Hold a dumbbell in the other hand with upper arm parallel to the torso. Extend the elbow to straighten the arm behind you, squeeze, then return to the start under control.

exercises.name: Cable Overhead Triceps Extension (Single-Arm)
exercises.short_description: Unilateral overhead triceps extension emphasizing long-head triceps with constant cable tension.
exercises.instructions: Attach a single handle to a low cable. Turn away from the stack, bring the handle overhead with elbow bent, and keep the upper arm near the head. Extend the elbow to straighten the arm overhead. Return slowly to a deep stretch, keeping the elbow pointed forward.
cues: Slow stretch on the way down
aliases: one arm cable overhead triceps extension

exercises.name: Band Triceps Pushdown
exercises.short_description: Triceps pushdown using resistance bands—portable and joint-friendly.
exercises.instructions: Anchor a band overhead. Grip the ends and start with elbows bent and tucked at your sides. Extend elbows to press the band down until arms are straight. Return under control to the start, keeping elbows pinned.

exercises.name: Zercher Squat
exercises.short_description: Front-loaded barbell squat held in the crook of the elbows to emphasize quads, trunk bracing, and upper-back tension.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on pins around lower-chest height. Step in close, hook the bar in the elbow creases, and clasp hands. Stand up tall, then step back and set stance. Take a breath and brace, sit down and back into a squat while keeping elbows up and torso tight. Descend to comfortable depth, then drive through midfoot to stand, keeping knees tracking over toes.
cues: Drive the floor away to stand

exercises.name: Overhead Squat
exercises.short_description: Barbell squat performed with the bar locked out overhead to challenge mobility, stability, and leg strength.
exercises.instructions: Snatch-grip the bar and press it overhead to locked elbows with active shoulders. Set feet at squat stance. Take a breath and brace, sit into the squat while keeping the bar over midfoot and arms straight. Reach depth while maintaining balance and upright control, then stand up keeping the bar stacked over shoulders/hips/feet.
cues: Push up into the bar the whole rep

exercises.name: Pause Back Squat
exercises.short_description: Back squat with a controlled pause at the bottom to build strength out of the hole and improve position.
exercises.instructions: Set up for a standard back squat. Descend under control to your intended depth, then hold the bottom position for 1–3 seconds without relaxing. Stay braced and balanced, then drive up to standing.
cues: Stay tight in the hole—don’t relax
Drive up with hips and shoulders together

exercises.name: Safety Bar Squat
exercises.short_description: Squat using a safety squat bar to reduce shoulder strain and increase upper-back/trunk demands.
