exercises.instructions: Place the safety bar across the upper back, grab the handles, and set your stance. Brace and squat down with control, keeping the torso tall and knees tracking. Drive up to full extension, maintaining a strong brace.
cues: Pull handles down to set your upper back
Knees forward and out as needed

exercises.name: Barbell Split Squat (Rear-Foot Elevated)
exercises.short_description: Rear-foot elevated split squat loaded with a barbell to target quads and glutes with high unilateral demand.
exercises.instructions: Set a bench behind you. Place the top of your rear foot on the bench and step the front foot out to a stable stance. Unrack a barbell on your back. Descend straight down until the front thigh is near parallel (or as mobility allows), keeping front heel down. Drive through the front foot to stand tall.
cues: Load the front leg; rear leg is support

exercises.name: Barbell Reverse Lunge
exercises.short_description: Reverse lunge performed with a barbell to emphasize glutes and quads with less knee stress than forward lunges.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on your back and stand tall. Step one leg back and lower under control until both knees are bent and the front foot stays flat. Push through the front foot to return to standing. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
cues: Step back far enough to keep balance
Push the floor away with the front foot

exercises.name: Barbell Hip Thrust (Feet Elevated)
exercises.short_description: Hip thrust variation with feet elevated to increase hip flexion range and glute challenge.
exercises.instructions: Set your upper back on a bench and place feet on a stable elevated surface (or bench) hip-width apart. Roll a barbell over the hips and brace. Drive hips up until hips are fully extended and ribs stay down. Pause, then lower under control to the bottom.
cues: Pause and squeeze glutes at the top

exercises.name: Deficit Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Deadlift pulled from a small elevation to increase range of motion and strengthen the pull from the floor.
exercises.instructions: Stand on a stable plate or low platform (1–3 inches). Set up for a conventional deadlift with the bar over midfoot. Brace, push the floor away, and stand up with the bar close to the body. Lower with control to the platform.

exercises.name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Hip-hinge deadlift variation with minimal knee bend to emphasize hamstrings and posterior chain.
exercises.instructions: Stand with barbell in hands at hip height. Set a slight knee bend and keep it nearly fixed. Hinge at the hips, sliding the bar down the legs until you feel a strong hamstring stretch while maintaining a flat back. Drive hips forward to return to standing.

exercises.name: Snatch-Grip Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Deadlift with a wide (snatch) grip to increase range of motion and upper-back involvement.
exercises.instructions: Take a wide grip on the bar (snatch width) and set up with hips and shoulders in strong pulling position. Brace and pull the bar from the floor to lockout while keeping it close. Lower under control to the floor and reset.
cues: Lock out with glutes, not low back

exercises.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
exercises.short_description: Beginner-friendly hinge using a kettlebell from the floor to build posterior-chain strength and patterning.
exercises.instructions: Place a kettlebell between your feet. Hinge back with a neutral spine and grab the handle with both hands. Brace and stand up by driving hips forward. Lower by hinging back and placing the bell down with control.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Sumo Squat
exercises.short_description: Wide-stance squat holding a dumbbell to emphasize adductors and glutes.
exercises.instructions: Hold a dumbbell vertically by one end (goblet hold) or by the handle. Take a wide stance with toes slightly out. Brace and squat down between the hips, keeping knees tracking over toes. Drive up to standing and repeat.

exercises.name: Cossack Squat
exercises.short_description: Deep lateral squat shifting side-to-side to build adductor strength, hip mobility, and single-leg control.
exercises.instructions: Take a wide stance. Shift your weight to one side, bending that knee and sitting back while keeping the other leg straight. Keep the working foot flat if possible and chest up. Push through the bent leg to return to center, then repeat to the other side.

exercises.name: Skater Squat
exercises.short_description: Single-leg squat pattern where the non-working leg reaches back to challenge balance and quad strength.
exercises.instructions: Stand on one leg with the other leg behind you. Lower into a single-leg squat, allowing the back knee to travel toward the floor behind you (light tap optional). Keep the torso controlled and front heel down. Drive up to standing and repeat, then switch sides.

exercises.name: Barbell Lateral Lunge
exercises.short_description: Side lunge loaded with a barbell to train frontal-plane strength and adductors/glutes.
exercises.instructions: Set a barbell on your back and stand tall with feet under hips. Step out to the side, sit hips back over the stepping leg, and keep the other leg straighter. Push off the stepping leg to return to center. Repeat for reps and switch sides.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
exercises.short_description: Walking lunge holding dumbbells at the sides to build unilateral leg strength and work capacity.
exercises.instructions: Hold dumbbells at your sides and stand tall. Step forward into a lunge, lowering until the rear knee approaches the floor and front foot stays flat. Drive through the front foot to step through into the next lunge. Continue alternating steps.
cues: Shorten stride if knees feel stressed

exercises.name: Smith Machine Hip Thrust
exercises.short_description: Hip thrust performed under a Smith machine for stable loading and easier setup.
exercises.instructions: Position a bench behind you for upper back support and set the Smith bar across your hips with padding. Plant feet about shoulder-width. Unrack, brace, and drive hips up to full extension. Pause and squeeze glutes, then lower under control and repeat.
cues: Shins near vertical at the top

exercises.name: Reverse Hyperextension (Machine)
exercises.short_description: Posterior-chain movement using a reverse hyper machine to train glutes/hamstrings with spinal decompression effect.
exercises.instructions: Lie face down on the reverse hyper pad with hips at the edge and legs hanging. Brace your trunk and swing/raise legs up by extending at the hips until legs are roughly in line with the torso. Lower under control to the start and repeat without excessive swinging.
cues: Move from the hips, not the low back

exercises.name: Glute-Ham Raise (GHD)
exercises.short_description: Hamstring-dominant posterior-chain exercise on a GHD to build knee flexion and hip extension strength.
exercises.instructions: Set up on the GHD with knees on the pad and ankles secured. Start with torso upright and hips extended. Lower your torso forward under control, keeping a straight line from knees to shoulders. Use hamstrings and glutes to pull back to upright, assisting with hands if needed.
cues: Keep hips extended—don’t fold at the waist
Drive hamstrings to pull you back

exercises.name: Standing Calf Raise (Machine)
exercises.short_description: Machine calf raise performed standing to target gastrocnemius and overall calf strength.
exercises.instructions: Set shoulders under the pads with balls of the feet on the platform and heels free. Start with a slight knee bend. Raise heels up as high as possible, pause, then lower heels down to a full stretch and repeat.
cues: Keep pressure through the big toe

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raise (Machine)
exercises.short_description: Seated machine calf raise emphasizing the soleus through bent-knee plantarflexion.
exercises.instructions: Sit with thighs under the pad and balls of the feet on the platform. Lower heels to a full stretch, then press through the forefoot to raise heels as high as possible. Pause briefly at the top and repeat.
cues: Full range: stretch then peak contraction
Keep knees stable under the pad
